She will use this new loan to increase her inventory by purchasing 5 boxes of salted cod, 5 boxes of salted sole and 5 boxes of salted tuna. She is very excited and expects a bright future, taken into account her ambition. She believes that she will always work with the microfinance institution Hope.

loans.use: To buy salted fish

loans.name: Idah

texts.en: Idah is a 60-year-old lady who runs St. Philomena Medical Clinic.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has been running the medical clinic for fifteen years.  She hopes to grow the business into a nursing home in the future.  Being a member of Joy Traders group in Faulu Kenya, she has been guaranteed a loan of 50,000 Kes.  With the loan, she will buy drugs. Idah is the mother of five adults.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. is divorced and has seven dependents. Efua smokes and fries fish for sale at Elmina. She uses her income to see to the welfare of the family. Efua will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy a plot of land.

At the time of the visit, Efua had  a few fried fish to display.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر ال 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في بيع الأقراص المدمجة والافلام وتعهدات صوتية يحب عمله جدا يعمل به منذ              
ان كان صغير حيث ان المصلحة لأهله يعمل بجد ونشاط يبرع في عمله يمتلك مهارات تخوله ان يتطور ويعتمد على نفسه وان ويملك محل خاص به                                                                                                               
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة شراء معدات صوتية جديدة لأنه يواجه منافسة من محيطه العملي يلقى دعم كبير من العائلة   وزبائنه                                                                                                           
يقصدونه من عدة مناطق لنشاطه وحبه للعمل لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة لكي يصبح قادر على منافسة محيطه في مجال عمله
texts.en: Mohamed is 22 years old.  He is single and earns a living through selling DVDs, CDs, movies, and audio equipment. He loves his job and has been operating his family’s business ever since he was young. He is active, passionate, and has the necessary skills to develop and become independent by owning a private business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he would like to purchase new sound equipment, as he faces strong competition from the field. Mohamed has the support of his family, and his clients come from different areas. He lacks the finances to be able to compete in the field.

loans.use: Purchase new audio equipment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently not in school.  Susan has a business in agriculture, which she has had for one year.  She rears animals.  

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase seeds and feed for the chickens.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Susan hopes to own a retail shop.        

Susan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her a job skill.

loans.use: seeds and feed for the chickens

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Хучаков Муродали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 61 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет с льготным периодом. Целью кредита является посев пшеницы. То есть он хочет закупить семена.
texts.en: Murodali K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 61 years old. He is married and has six children. He has secondary education. He has been in agriculture for more than ten years. He has a plot of land by his home where he sows wheat. He is taking out the loan with a grace period with the purpose of sowing wheat. He wants to buy the seeds of wheat for sowing.

loans.use: To sow wheat

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Aisha has a poultry business which she has had for three years.  She also does farming.  

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase seeds and more chickens.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  

In the future, Aisha hopes to own a wholesale shop.   Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: seeds and more chickens

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 26-year-old single mother. She runs a computer accessories shop. She has been in the business for four years with an income of 19,000 per month.She has no history with any other microfinance institution.

Caroline was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET which she intends to use to buy more hard disks, mother boards and other stock for her business.

She hopes to have her business expand and build her own house, educate her child, and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy hard disks, mother boards and other stock for the business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. is a fishmonger at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been a fishmonger for five years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 37, is housewife and she always holds to her daily routine such as cooking, cleaning house, and so on every day. She has a life partner in her husband who is 41 years old and a fisherman who works along a local river. 

Keo S. is the mother of four teenager children, three of whom are single. One is married and has a job as a building worker. Her son also helps her out by contributing some of his income to help the family meet daily expenses. 

Keo S. said her son always goes to work by hiring a taxi and he pays a lot of money when he needs to travel. To encourage her son, Keo S. would to request a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her son.  Keo S. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her son

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Jennifer has a pig production business which she has had for two years.  She also does agriculture.  

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase feed for the pigs.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jennifer hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

 In the future, Jennifer hopes to own a retail shop.    Jennifer is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her find new friends.

loans.use: feed for the pigs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is married and has three children. She sells cooked rice and beans at Elmina,which she has been doing for ten years. Her husband is a steel bender. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Esi will use the loan to expand her cooking business. She plans to reinvest her additional income back into her business.

loans.use: expand her cooking business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 25 سنة غير متزوج لديه عائلة محبوبة يعمل بجد ونشاط يحب عمله كثيرا يفتقر للبضائع الجديدة لتطوير عمله يعمل       
في مجال بيع التفلونات واكسسوار التلفونات يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تحسين المحل وشراء بضاعة تلفونات جديدة      زبائنه من محيطه                                                                                                   
يريد ان يغيير من وضعه المادي بحيث يزيد مدخوله فهو يعاني منافسة كبيرة في محيطه العملي
texts.en: Ahmed is 25 years old. He is single and has close ties with his family. Ahmed is passionate about his job. He needs to purchase new products to improve his business. Ahmed earns a living by selling telephone sets and accessories. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he will be able to improve his business and purchase new products for his clients. Ahmed would like to improve his income as he faces strong competition.

loans.use: Purchase new telephone sets and accessories

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba B. sells palm oil and cassava dough at Elmina. She is married and has ten dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm oil and cassava dough to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in other foodstuffs for resale.

loans.use: buy more palm oil and cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa A. is divorced and has six dependents. Adjowa cooks rice and serves it with tomato sauce at Elmina.  Adjowa uses her income to see to the welfare of the family. Adjowa will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjowa plans to reinvest any additional income.

loans.use: add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Peter Nzioka

texts.en:
Peter is 65 years old and married to Peninnah. He has two children he  supports. He has a retail shop which has been running for seven years with an income of 10,000 Kshs. per month.

He has good history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his third loan of Kshs.40,000, with which he intends to buy sugar, maize flour, soaps and detergent. He hopes to educate his children and help them have their own properties so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, soaps and detergent

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a widow with six children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

She operates a second-hand clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Regina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a shop in the future.              

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bale of used clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good relations.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa N. sells provisions and charcoal at Elmina. She is a widow and has six dependants. She is responsible for the welfare of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her dependants’ education.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Prospere

texts.fr:
Vendeuse des beignets, elle est très motivée dans ce domaine. Elle a épargnée pendanttout le cycle de remboursements et sa participation était régulière.

Si ses revenues ont augmentés, c’est grâce au  prêt passé qui a améliore entre autre sa manière de gérer son commerce et elle a appris : l’étude de faisabilité, le journal de caisse , la gestion de stock.
La solidarité  mutuelle du groupe a été pour elle une grande école d’apprentissage.
Elle vendait  par jour  25000f jour  maintenant contre 8000 frs  avant.
Le prochain prêt sera pour elle, serait  une occasion de faire plus de bénéfices et elle va augmenter son stock en achetant : 1 sacs de farine de blé, 1 sacde riz, 1 sac de sucre, 1 bidon d’huile, 1 sacde lait en poudre, 4 sacs de charbon, 1 carton de levure boulangère, les arômes, en plus elle a amenage un lieu pour que ses clients puissent prendre le riz au lait, les beignets et les galettes sur place, c'est pour cela qu'elle a achete des tables en plastiques et des chaises pour commencer son petit restaurant.
Divorcé, elle peut maintenant s’occuper valablement de ses enfants, payer leur scolarite et epargner pour leur futur.
texts.en:
This woman sells beignets (fritters), and is highly motivated in her activities. She accumulated savings throughout the entire loan repayment cycle, and her involvement remained consistent.

Her revenue increased thanks to the latest loan, which helped to improve her business management methods by learning about feasibility studies, the petty cash book, and inventory management. The mutual solidarity of the group was a great learning resource for her. Her sales went from 8,000 francs to 25,000 francs per day.

She hopes to bolster her profits with the next loan, which she will use it to increase her stocks by buying one bag of wheat flour, one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, one can of oil, one bag of powdered milk, four bags of coal, one container of baking yeast, and some flavorings. 

Having purchased plastic tables and chairs to start a small restaurant, she was able to set up a place where her customers can enjoy their rice pudding, fritters and pancakes on the spot. 

Being divorced, she is now able to care properly for her children, pay their tuition, and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, sugar, milk, oil, butter and margarine

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Mrs. Kol C., 57, is a single mother who has been living in Phnom Penh City. She is now a housewife. Mrs. Kol C. is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her three children, even though she is recently divorced from her husband. She has two children who live separately and lives with her. The main income of her family comes from her son who works as dentist in a private company. Currently, his existing motorbike often  breaks down during use. Because of that, Mrs. Kol C. has decided to seek a loan of $500 from Kiva, which she will use to change the broken motorcycle for her son. Mrs. Kol C. was not available at that day, so her son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To change the broken motorcycle for her son.

loans.name: Stephen Mwangi

texts.en:
Stephen is a 28-year-old shoe seller. He is married to Margaret, a business lady. They are blessed with one child who is five years old. Stephen has been selling shoes for the past two years. His monthly income is Kshs.12,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He will use the loan to add to his stock of new shoes to sell, specifically shoes for this December season. With the anticipated profit from the business, he intends to expand the business and develop a permanent premise where he will be selling his shoes. 

Mwangi has never borrowed from any MFI (microfinance institution) and he was introduced to KADET LTD through a Kadet credit officer. Stephen is applying for his first loan from Kadet. His hopes and dreams are to own a piece of land and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. makes corn dough and cassava dough at Elmina. She is a widow and has been selling corn and cassava dough for 10 years. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and cassava to make the dough for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a house.
In this picture, Ama has in her hand a sample of corn dough she sells.

loans.use: To buy more maize and cassava to make dough for sale.

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.ru: Менгатова Гулрафтор проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 34 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет большой продуктовый и парфюмерный магазин. В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Gulraftor M. lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She has secondary education. She does sales. She owns a big grocery and perfume shop near her house. She has been in this business for four years. She is taking out the loan to increase sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. is a widow taking care of seven dependants. Araba sells foodstuffs such as canned tomatoes, okra, onions, pepper and other items at Elmina. Araba uses her income to see to the welfare of her family. Araba will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to educate her dependants.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a single man who lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transport costs.

He has operated a hawking business, selling charcoal stoves for over two years door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Kennedy faces the major challenge of theft because of a lack of security in his area of operation. He hopes to establish a retail shop to sell his products in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase a mkokoteni (hand cart) and the Kenyan ceramic jiko (stove) for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it offers affordable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a mkokoteni (hand cart ) and the Kenyan ceramic jiko (stove) for resale.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat L. is a 64-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Tat L. is married to Mr. Bou Reang, age 69. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to six children. Two of the children are single and four are married. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Mrs. Tat L. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later, when the price is increasing. She will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: To buy more rice at a low cost to stock and sell when the price rises.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase trousers and shirts

loans.name: Hadi

texts.ar:
هادي في عمر 26 سنة متزوج وله ولدان طموح يحب عائلته يرغب في تحسين وضع عائلته المادي وزيادة مدخوله فهو خباز  يعمل في فرن للمناقيش                                                                                                        
يعتمد على ذاته منذ اكثر من 9 سنوات تاريخ بدء عمله فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى فتح محل جديد له لتكبير       مصلحته يلقى دائما دعم كبير من عائلته                                                                              
وهو محبوب من محيطه وزبائنه طموح يحلم بفتح اكثر من محل في المستقبل تاريخه السابق مع المجموعة جيد جدا
texts.en: Hadi is a 26-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much and seeks to improve their financial situation; they, for their part, are a big support to him. Hadi has been self-reliant for the past nine years as he’s worked at a fateera pastry shop. He is seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to open a new shop to expand his business. Hadi is well-liked by his colleagues and patrons. He is very driven, and dreams of opening up multiple other outlets in the future. His credit history with Al Majmoua is very good.

loans.use: Open up new shop.

loans.name: Akpene Lea

texts.fr:
A.   Akpene lea
Elle a 24 ans et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d’articles d’alimentation générale. Elle cumule près de 10 ans dans cette activité. Elle a sollicité plusieurs prêts qui été remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local de hédzranawoe. Le crédit demandé permettra de renouveler de nouveaux stocks d’articles d’alimentation.
texts.en: A. Akpene Lea is 24 years old. She makes a living by selling general food products. She has 10 years of experience in this business. She had obtained several loans in the past, all well repaid. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells at the local market of Hédzranawoe. The loan she is requesting will allow her to replenish her stock of groceries.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith N. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Edith has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Edith sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Edith has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through a small restaurant. The main business challenges for Edith include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler.  Edith lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maame Afia

texts.en: Maame Afia B. is married and has seven dependants. Maame is into the sale of provisions and utensils at Abura, which she has been doing for 11 years. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband in making sure that the family is in good health. The loan she is asking for will be added to her initial income to expand her business. She anticipates using her additional income to build a house.

loans.use: To add to her initial income to expand her business.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child. None of her children is currently in school.  Madinah has a business selling food, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Madinah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Madinah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Madinah hopes to own a plot. Madinah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her a job skill.

loans.use: To buy food to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Prossy has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase maize flour and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Prossy hopes to become a doctor.        

Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her netball.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar

loans.name: Serrah

texts.en: Serrah A. is married and has five dependants. She prepares tea for sale (tea served with fried eggs and bread) at Abura. Serrah uses the income she makes from her sales to assist her husband to take care of the home. She says the loan will help her to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Serrah plans to buy land.

loans.use: To help her to expand her business.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua D. is married to a driver and together they live with their seven dependants. Akua sells utensils and secondhand clothes at Abura. She has been in this trade for 15 years. She assists her husband in educating her dependants. Akua will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Hadijah has a business selling food, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hadijah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Hadijah hopes to own a retail shop. Hadijah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her capital.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal, bitter balls, pepper, seasoning, salt, etc.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.ar:
سوسن في عمر 47سنة متعلمة ونشيطة تحب عملها وعائلتها متزوجة ولديها ولدان تسعى الى تعليمهم وتربيتهم بوضع مادي مريح      
فهي تعمل منذ اكثر من 10 سنوات محيطها يدعمها ويحبها كثيرا فهي ذات نشاط في العمل كبير تعمل في بيع الالبسة متجول زبائنها    يحبونها                                                                                                             
تريد طلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء بضاعة جديدة لتكبير مصلحتها وهي لا تجد صعوبات تاريخها مع المجموعة جيد وكانت تتلقى دعم من عائلتها
texts.en: Sawsan is an educated 47-year-old wife and mother of two for whom she strives very hard to ensure a decent education and upbringing. Her family and friends in turn are very loving and supportive. Sawsan is very go-getting in her work as a street clothes vendor, which she has been occupied in for the past decade; her customers are very well disposed toward her. Given her good credit history with Al Majmoua, Sawsan is now seeking another loan to purchase more wares to further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells secondhand clothes at Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband to provide her family with their basic needs.  Her loan will be used to buy extra used clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children's education.

loans.use: To buy extra used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah B. lives in the single neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (twin brother’s children).   

Sarah has a business of a retail shop selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Sarah   sells her products at the market, by means of retail.   

Sarah has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and cream relaxers.  The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also start  importing cosmetics.    

Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and cream relaxers for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia B. is married and has two children. She is a seamstress at Abura. Her husband is into farming. Afia uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Afia will use the loan to purchase additional cloth and other materials so she can sew to meet the demands of her customers.  She will reinvest the additional income she is going to get as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloths and other materials

loans.name: Calmelita

texts.en:
Calmelita G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Tugas, Brgy. Ocoy, Sta. Fe, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish vending  business.   Her husband Antonio Ilustrisimo, who is 49 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.They have 6 children who are 18 to 46 years old with 4 of them having their own family.  

Calmelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Calmelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for the future and become financially stable. 

Calmelita G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. processes palm oil for sale at Abura. She is married and has 10 dependants. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profit.

In the photo, Ama is in the process of making palm oil.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua G. is divorced and has two children. Akua cooks banku and serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce at Abura. She uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. Akua will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to educate her children.

In this picture, Akua has finished selling the banku she had cooked for the day. She had a few of the fried fish and is showing the pot she uses for the banku.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare banku to sell

loans.name: Rouayda

texts.ar:
رويده عوض الساحلي: رويده في عمر 40 سنة متزوجة ولها ولد تعمل من اكثر من 9 سنوات تعمل في بيع الاحذية الاوروبية المستعملة
محل خاص لها لكنه بمبلغ مرتفع تحب تحسين وضع عائلتها المادي والاستفادة من عملها
فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وزيادة مدخولها الشهري زبائنها كثر وهم من محيطها
وجيرانها تاريخها الاقتراضي مع المجموعة جيد وقد اثر هذا القرض على حياتها بشكل اجابي
texts.en: Rouayda Awad as-Sahily is a 40-year-old wife and mother of one who has nine years of experience in selling used European footware. She runs her own shop, although the rent is somewhat high. Since Rouayda is keen to improve her family’s financiA. situation and further make the most of her work, she is seeking a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase new merchandise. Rouayda’s many customers come from her neighbors and colleagues. She has a good credit history with A. Majmoua, and the last loan very positively affected her life.

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for shop.

loans.name: Mary Adjoa Mansah

texts.en:
Mary Adjoa Mansah E. is into the extraction of palm oil at Abrafo near Abura. Mary has received a junior high education. She is married and has four children. The loan she is asking for will be used to acquire more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education to her children.

Mary is standing by some palm fruits she will be using for the oil.

loans.use: To acquire more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish and peanut for resale

loans.name: Ama Afranso Helena

texts.en: Ama Afranso Helena B. is a widow taking care of four children. She has received junior high education. Ama sells foodstuffs such as fish, salt, onions, cannned tomatoes and others at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs and others that are requested by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and others that are requested by her customers.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is married and has two children. Adwoa displays provisions on top of a table at Abura for sale. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting the loan to purchase more provisions for sale. Adwoa plans to build a shop from her increased profit.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Justina Ekua Bosuaa

texts.en: Justina Ekua Bosuaa B. is a hairdresser at Elmina. She also sells gari, sugar and groundnuts that have been bagged in smaller quantities. Justina has no educational background. She is asking to use the loan to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa B. sells ladies underwear, Fante kenkey, meat and other items at Abura. Yaa is married and takes care of five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses the income she makes from her sales in assisting her husband to take care of her family. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to educate her dependants.

loans.use: Yaa will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell.

loans.name: Georges

texts.ar:
جورج في عمر 42 سنة يعمل في بيع البسة نسائي متزوج وله ولد له في مصلحته اكثر من 7 سنوات كان يعمل خارج بلده ثم اراد الرجوع والعمل 
في الوطن يحب عمله كثيرا يرغب في تحسين وضعه المادي ووضع عائلته يتلقى دائما دعم من عائلته خاصة بعد رجوعه الى بلده هو يطمح بمستقبل واعد فهو نشيط
له زبائن من جيرانه ومحيطه يريد ان يعيد بناء مستقبل له في بلده فهو يطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف زيادة بضائع للمحل وتحسين وضع المحل
texts.en: Georges is a 42-year-old husband and father of one with more than seven years of experience working in women’s clothing retail. After working abroad for a while, he finally came home. He loves his work very much and desires to improve the financial situation of his family, who has always supported him, but especially since his return. With lots of energy, he is driven to build a more promising future for himself in his motherland, working with his patrons who come from his neighbors and colleagues. Accordingly, Georges was interested in seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to acquire more merchandise for his business and make improvements to his shop.

loans.use: Buy new merchandise and make improvements to shop.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi E. is a palm oil extractor at Watreso near Abura. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is into crop farming.  Asi uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to process into oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Asi plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruits to process into oil for sale

loans.name: Manga

texts.en:
Manga is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills and food for the family.

She has operated a food stall business for five years, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. Manga faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bags of maize flour, wheat flour and beans for her food stall business.
She decided to join Yehu because its near her place of operations.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize flour, wheat flour and beans for her food stall business.

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Valle Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO “LA ESPERANZA DEL VALLE”, ESTÁ INTEGRADO POR OCHO PARTICIPANTES, QUIENES SE CARACTERIZAN POR EL DESEO D. PROGRESAR A BASE D. MUCHO TRABAJO. 
LA SRA. ROSARIO DEL PILAR, PARTICIPANTE ACTIVA D. ÉSTE GRUPO DESD. HACE OCHO MESES, ACTUALMENTE OCUPA EL CARGO D. TESORERA,  ELLA TIENE 47 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE 4 HIJOS QUE SON SU INCENTIVO Y A LA VEZ APOYO PARA SALIR ADELANTE.
LA SRA. ROSARIO DEL PILAR  REALIZA DIVERSAS ACTIVIDADES PARA PODER GENERAR INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS, UNA D. ESAS ACTIVIDADES ES LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA POR CATALOGO, PARA LO CUAL  MEDIANTE MUCHO ESFUERZO HA LOGRADO CAPTAR CIERTA CLIENTELA.
ROSARIO EL PILAR  TIENE ENTRE SUS METAS TERMINAR D. CONSTRUIR SU VIVIENDA, IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO, LA EDUCACION D. SUS HIJOS, QUE ELLOS SEAN MEJOR QUE ELLA Y CREZCAN PROFESIONALMENTE. CON EL ESFUERZO D. SU TRABAJO, ELLA HA PODIDO PAGAR  UNA PARTE DEL TERRENO D. SU VIVIENDA Y AYUDAR EN LA ECONOMIA D. SU HOGAR.
EL RECIENTE PRESTAMO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA D. JUGUETES EN ESTA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza del Valle” (Hope of the Valley) group has eight members who are characterized by their desire to make progress through their hard work.

Rosario del Pilar has been an active member of this group for eight months.  Currently she is the group's treasurer.  She is 47 years old.  She is a single mother and has 4 children who are her incentive and support in getting ahead.

Rosario del Pilar carries out a number of business activities to generate income.  One of these activities is the sale of beauty products from a catalog.  With a lot of effort she has managed to attract a number of customers.

Rosario el Pilar has a number of goals including to finish building her home, to keep her business going, to educate her children so that they can do better than her and to grow professionally.  Through the effort of her work she has managed to pay for part of the land her house is on and to help with household finances.

The current loan will be used to buy toys for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy toys for the Christmas season

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica N. lives in the  Kitawuluzi  neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.      

Monica  has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.    Monica sells her products from home, by means of retail.   

Monica  has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more boxes of  soap, a bag of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income through tailoring.

The main business challenges for    Monica  include transportation  and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler.    

Monica  lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
G. afi
Elle a 50 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est née à Lomé et vit plus  précisément à adidogomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de soutiens gorges et cumule dans cette activité 7 ans d’expérience. Elle s’approvisionne au marché hédzranawoe en gros et redistribue en détail. Avec le crédit sollicité, elle espère accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: G. Afi is 50 years old, married and mother to two children. She was born in Lomé and more precisely lives in Adidogomé. She has an income-generating activity selling bras and has seven years experience in this business. She gets her supplies wholesale at the market in Hédzranawoe, and resells them on a retail basis. With the loan she is requesting, she is hoping to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of bras

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Egnoname

texts.fr: Egnonam a 26 ans et mère d’un enfant.  Elle est mariée à un agent d’impôt et réside au niveau du tokoin hôpital. En effet, elle avait sollicité  plusieurs crédits qui ont été remboursés.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la vente d’alimentation. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend à total kodomé vers nyekonakpoe.  L’objet de ce credit sera destiné à l’achat de 2 bidons d’huile, 5 sacs de riz et 10 cartons de tomate.
texts.en: Egnonam is 26 years old and mother to one child. She is married to a tax officer and lives in the area near to the Tokoin hospital. She has, in fact, requested several loans in the past, which have been repaid. In order to contribute something to the household, she has a business selling food. She buys her products at the large market in Lomé and sells them all in Kodomé on the way to Nyekonakpoe. This loan will be used to buy two containers of oil, five sacks of rice and ten boxes of tomatoes

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over ten years, she has been selling lesos (kikois) from door to door to her neighbours and passers-by. Ann faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation incurred when moving from door to door selling kikois. She hopes to start selling clothes and shoes in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of lesos (kikois) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos (kikois) for resale

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
YASAIDA LUPE, ES MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, Y TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD. ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "LOS ANGELES", EL CUAL RECIENTEMENTE ACABA DE FORMARCE, Y SE ENCUENTRA INTEGRADO POR 07  SOCIAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE VILLA JUANITA EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
DESDE HACE UN AÑO, LA SRA. YASAIDA LUPE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAZAMORRA DE CALABAZA EN LAS AFUERAS DE UN COLEGIO. SE INICA EN ESTE NEGOCIO YA QUE EN EL COLEGIO DE SU HIJO, A LOS NIÑOS LES GUSTA MUCHO ESTE POSTRE, ASI ES QUE YASALDA DECIDE PONER ESTE NEGOCIO, Y ES ASI COMO INICIA UNA FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA SU HOGAR, PERMITIENDOLE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SUS HIJOS Y CRECER CON SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO.
CON EL ESFUERZO DE SU TRABAJO YASADIA LUPE HA LOGRADO INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO Y LOGRAR LA CAPTACION DE UNA MAYOR CLIENTELA, SU GRAN ANHELO ES PONER UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN SU NEGOCIO Y EN LA COMPRA DE JUGUETES PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVIDEÑA.
texts.en:
27-year old Yasaida Lupe is a single mother of two young children. She is the current president of the recently-formed “Los Angeles” group. The group is comprised of seven members who live in the neighbourhood of Villa Juanista in Carabayllo district.

For the last year Sra. Yasaida has earned her living by selling mazamorra de calabaza (a Peruvian pumpkin-based dessert) outside a school. She started this business because at her son’s school, the children really like this dessert. The job provides an income for the household and allows Yasaida to improve the standard of living of her children.

By putting a lot of effort into her work, Yasaida has managed to expand the business and gain more customers. Her great wish is to open a stall in the market. The loan she is seeking will be invested in the business and the purchase of toys for the Christmas season.

loans.use: purchase of toys to resell in the Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother).       

Madina has a business selling cereals.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.    Madina sells her products at the market, by means of retail.       

Madina has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of maize, beans, sorghum and ground nuts.    

The main business challenges for  Madina include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler, and also to educate her children up to university.    Madina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, maize, beans, and ground nuts

loans.name: Fantché

texts.fr: Marié et père d’un enfant, il a 29 ans. Il est né à atakpamé et habite à Lomé à adidogomé. Il exerce comme activité principale la réparation de portables mais associe la vente des accessoires de portables. Habituellement, il achète au grand marché de Lomé et dekon et exerce cette activité il y a de cela 7 ans. En plus le siège de son activité se trouve à côté de la douane adidogomé. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 4 cartons de batteries et 2 cartons de chargeur.
texts.en: Married and the father of one child, he is 29 years old. He is born in Atakpamé and lives in Lomé, in Adidogomé. He makes a living by repairing cells phones and also by selling phone accessories. Usually he stocks up at the big market of Lomé and Dekon; he has been in this business for 7 years. His shop is by the Customs office of Adidogomé. He is seeking this loan in order to purchase four boxes of batteries and two boxes of chargers.

loans.use: Purchasing cell phone accessories

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Comité Juntas Podemos es un excelente  comité conformado el 08 de Enero del 2010, integrado por 20 mujeres.
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Amancia A. que  se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 3° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Es uno de los mejores grupos que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amancia  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella es una mujer que procura diariamente por su familia. 
Y con la ayuda que recibe de parte de sus amigas del comité han está logrando mejorar su negocio renovando sus mercaderías, y recurriendo a otras técnicas de ventas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías (ropas como: remeras, camisas, pantalones, shorts, y otros) para su negocio ya que la temporada de mucha venta con la época festiva siempre llega, y desea satisfacer todos los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
The excellent Juntas Podemos (Together We Can) group was formed on January 8th, 2010, and is composed of twenty women. It was formed thanks to the efforts of Sra. Amancia A. who approached the advisor at a credit renewal meeting she was holding in the area regarding the program for working women. The advisor was very enthusiastic and wanted to work with the group. Now they have been happily working together for three loan cycles.

The group is one of the best working with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya as the majority of the women in the group have been doing the same work since the time of the first loan, thus demonstrating their commitment and friendship.

One of the members is Sra. Amancia who earns her living by selling clothing on a daily basis to support her family. With the help of her friends in the group, she has succeeded in improving her business, updating her stock, and using other sales techniques. 

Amancia is seeking a loan to buy more clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, shorts etc. for her business as the high season for sales is approaching, and she wants to be able to fulfill all her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, shorts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy red (palm) oil to resell

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en: M. Jonas is 28 years old and has been engaged in an agriculture business, mainly dealing in Irish potatoes, beans and cassava for the last 8 years in Rutabo-Kyenjojo. It is a business that has been bringing weekly profits of 30,000 shillings. Self-initiative is what he says got him started herein. Jonas is a father to 3 kids.  With this loan, Joans says he is going to buy more beans and maize seeds to grow.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize seeds

loans.name: Manya

texts.en:
Manya Z. lives in Ijevan city with her departed brother’s family. Since 2000, Manya has been engaged in trading, which she ran in Ijevan market. 

With the income from her business she was able to buy her own stall near the market, where Manya is now managing food trading. Thanks to her business' income, she supports herself, provides part of her brother’s family needs and bought furniture for their house.

Manya is seeking for a 550,000 AMD loan to buy cheese from villagers to resell and other foodstuffs for her shop.

loans.use: To buy cheese and foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El joven Jorge B. S. tiene 21 años y vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona Norte en un barrio conocido como Villa Huanuni. Jorge actualmente vive con sus padres mientras estudia y trabaja.

Jorge Estudia Electro mecánica en el instituto INFOCAL y trabaja como ayudante de mecánica en la Mecánica Automotriz SETRA. Jorge trabaja por más de 2 años y es esta la profesión que eligió y que le apasiona. Jorge desea crédito para poder comprar herramientas de trabajo y de esta manera poder comenzar a realizar reparaciones por su cuenta y ganar unos pesos extras.

El mayor sueño de Jorge es poder algún día abrir una Mecánica de su propiedad y de esa manera tener un mejor futuro y generar los suficientes ingresos para poder mantener el solo a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge B. Saldia is a young man aged 21. He lives in the town of Cochabamba in the northern zone in a neighbourhood known as Villa Huanuni. He currently lives with his parents while he studies and works.

Jorge is studying electrical engineering in the INFOCAL Institute. He has also been working as an assistant mechanic at Mecánica Automotriz SETRA for over two years. He chose this profession and loves it. Jorge wants a loan to buy tools so that he can begin doing repairs on his own and thus earn a bit of extra money.

His greatest dream is to be able to open his own workshop one day so that he can have a better future and earn enough money to support the whole family on his own.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Ablavi Kafui

texts.fr: Ablavi est mariée à un comptable et mère d’un enfant. Pour participer au menage , elle exerce le commerce de pagnes et chaussures et compte dans cette activité 4 ans d’expérience.  Elle est née à Lomé et habite nyekonakpoè.Elle achète généralement au grand marché de Lomé et revend à nyekonakpoè.  Elle sollicite un nouveau credit pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Ablavi has one child and is married to an accountant. Born in Lomé, she now lives in Nyekonakpoè. 

To help with the household expenses, she sells pagnes (colorful print cloth) and shoes. She has four years of experience in this activity. She usually gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé for resale in Nyekonakpoè. 

She is seeking a new loan to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy pagnes and shoes

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over seven years, she has been selling Khanga's from door to door to her neighbours and passers-by. Asha faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to open a stall and purchase a bundle of Khanga's. She decided to join Yehu because its near her place of operation.

loans.use: To open a stall and purchase Khanga's for resale

loans.name: Tettey

texts.fr: Tettey a 54 ans,  marié et père de 3 enfants.  Il est né à accra au ghana et habite à Kodjoviakopé à Lomé. Il exerce comme activité principale la couture et associe la vente de tissus. Il a remboursé plusieurs  credit déjà. Il s’approvisionne à paris en France et revend à lomé à nyekonakpoe ou il a son activité principale. Avec le credit sollicité, il compte acheter 2 rouleaux de tissus.
texts.en: Tettey is 54, married, and father to 3 children. He was born in Accra in Ghana and lives in Kodjoviakopé in Lomé. He is in the sewing business and also sells fabric. He has already repaid several loans. He stocks up in Paris, France and resells in Lomé in Nyekonakpoe where his business is located. With this loan, he plans to buy two rolls of fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a widow and resides in a city named Mian Chano in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. She has an extended family, where her brother-in-law also lives with her family. 

Zubaida keeps herself busy by operating her dairy business. She keeps some buffaloes at her home, from whom she gets milk to sell in her neighboring areas.  She also has a grocery store at her home. She uses a room in her house for this purpose. After finishing selling the milk, she tends to her grocery shop business.
  
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo.  That will help her increase the milk quantity and fulfill the demands of more customers. 

She hopes that this loan investment will help her business grow further and she will be able to provide better facilities in life to her family.   She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Ayawoa Gbodzidi

texts.fr: Ayawoa a 33 ans,  mariée et mère de  2 enfants. Elle  a sollicité plusieurs crédits  qui ont été remboursés.  Elle exerce comme activité génératrices de revenus la vente d’ananas et de maïs et cumule près de 2 ans dans cette activité. Elle s’approvisionne à azahun et kovié  et revend ensuite  au marché local d’assiyéyé. L’objet de ce prêt  sera destiné à l’achat de 12 paniés d’ananas et 10 sacs de maïs pour répondre au mieux à la clientèle.

loans.use: achat d'ananas et maïs

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother).       

Prossy has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Prossy sells her products at the market, by means of retail.   

Prossy has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  The main business challenges for Prossy include transportation and seasonality.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler, and also to educate her children up to university.    Prossy lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family.   She is 40 years old, married to N. M., and has 3 sons.  Her eldest son left his education after 5th class and started doing labor work to financially support the family. Her 2 younger sons are enrolled in school and are getting their education.
 
Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He operates a shop in the market where he fulfills the demands of his customers. He is experienced in his business and known in the area for his quality of service.

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in bulk quantity.  That will enable him to increase his sales and earnings.  She is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him better profits in the future.  She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en:
Marie Claudine is 26 years old and married to a vet. She has two young children who are nine months and four years old. Her oldest child attends school. Marie Claudine sells seeds and fertilizers. She has been in this business for about four years. 

She would like to get a loan to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers to sell.  She is pleased with her business as it allows her to provide for the needs of her family. 

The profit from this business will be used to buy a cow to provide milk for her children. In the future, she hopes to get a larger loan amount of 800,000 Rwandan francs.

loans.use: To buy  more seeds and fertilizers to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 30 years old.  She is married and has three children who are between ten months and five years old.  None of her children attend school. Jeanne sells cattle and she has spent four years in this business. 

She needs this loan to buy more cattle to sell.  She hopes to pay school fees for her children and build a house from the expected profits of this business.  In the future she wishes to have a much larger herd of cattle compared to what she has now.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is 52 years old. She is married and has four children who are between the ages of 14 and 30. Her youngest child attends school. Her husband works as a farmer. Liberatha sells locally-produced juice, yellow bananas and avocados. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for five years. 

She has requested this loan to add more produce to sell.  She believes her business to have been successful because she has managed to pay school fees for her children and has also bought a goat. With her profits she plans to buy a bicycle which will help her in the daily operations of her business through transporting her goods.  She dreams of being a millionaire in the future!

loans.use: To buy more bananas and avocados to sell

loans.name: Julienne Félicité

texts.fr: Julienne est âgée de 33 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Pour contribuer au menage, elle fait la vente de pagnes où elle tire ses revenus. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier vakpossito. Elle achète en gros les pagnes et redistribue en détail. Elle a remboursé  plusieurs prêt déjà à WAGES. Avec ce nouveau credit, Elle espère augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Julienne is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children. To help with the housekeeping, she sells traditional garments which gives her some income. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Vakpossito neighbourhood. She buys the garments wholesale and redistributes them retail. She has already repaid several loans to WAGES. With this new loan she hopes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: purchase of garments

loans.name: Hafeez's Group

texts.en:
Hafeez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo.  That will help him sell more quantities of milk to more clients. 

Hafeez is 50 years old, a mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her sons are illiterate and are involved in the business of selling animal feed. Her daughter is studying in the 5th class.
 
Hafeez herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household work. She also helps her husband in his business. She takes care of his buffaloes by giving them food and water on time. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she timely paid her installments and attended every meeting. She is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband’s business will be improved, and that will result in a positive financial outcome.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Kathreen's Group

texts.en:
Kathreen lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan. She came here after her marriage. Kathreen's husband is a mason by trade but he also provides construction supplies to his customers. She is a 44-year-old lady who owns and operates her dairy business at her home. Currently, she has a buffalo that produces almost 8kg milk every day. She sells 1kg milk for PKRs 45, which has become the fixed amount in every city. She sells milk to different milk shops and earns a good income. Her income allows her to manage the finances of her family circle. Although Kathreen is a working lady, she also does her household work very efficiently. 

Kathreen has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her sons are illiterate and they support their mother in her milk-selling business by delivering the milk to the milk shops. Her daughter is enrolled in a local school and is getting her education. 

Kathreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production of her business. She is hopeful that after this loan investment her business will reach a more profitable position and generate a better income for her. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Nchue Ole

texts.en:
Nchue Ole S. is 35 years old. He is married to Margdaline S. and is a father of four school-going children, aged between two to seven years. 

Nchue practises mix farming, whereby he rears animals and grows wheat on his own piece of land.  He has been doing this for the last six  years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his second loan.  He is planning to plant wheat, which has proved to be doing very well in this area, and to buy and keep some sheep for fattening to sell later. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production and sheep rearing.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat for commercial purpose.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer, both in wheat farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To plant wheat and purchase sheep to rear for resale

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
a El Comité Jazmín es un  comité está conformado el 12 de setiembre de 2010, integrado por 16 mujeres de la Ciudad de Capiatá. 
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra.   Andresa B. quien se dedica a la venta de comidas. 
Actualmente es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. 
La señora Liz es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de lencería sobre pedido, forma de trabajo de ella ofrece mediante catálogos sus productos y de acuerdo a los gustos de cada clientas ella compra las mercaderías. 
Sus productos son variados y los precios que ella maneja son bastantes accesibles. 
Cuenta con un buen número de clientas quienes frecuentemente solicitan sus mercaderías, ella se encuentra satisfecha con la venta de productos ya que de esa manera ayuda a su familia. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como lencería, cosméticos, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
The Comité Jazmín ["Jasmine Group"] was formed on September 12, 2010 and is made up of 16 women from the city of Capiatá.  This group came together thanks to Ms. Andresa B., who is a food seller.  Nowadays, they are a very active group and all of the members show fellowship and solidarity.  They attend weekly meetings and conduct activities to raise funds for the common good of the group.

Ms. Liz is one of the members and she works selling women's undergarments.  Her sales method is to offer her products by catalog and then to buy merchandise according to what her customers would like.  Her products are varied and the prices she offers are fairly accessible.  She has a good number of customers who regularly order her merchandise, and she feels satisfied with her product sales because it is a way to help her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise like lingerie, cosmetics, perfume, and other items.

loans.use: to buy women's undergarments, cosmetics, and perfumes

loans.name: Willberforce Patu

texts.en:
Willberforce Nkaiwatei  is 25 years old, married, and they have one child.  He is a farmer and farms his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to spend on his twenty-acre wheat farm. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land and eradicate poverty in his family, plant more wheat for commercial purpose,  and also build some rental houses.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy his own tractor for land ploughing.  Willberforce believes he is hard-working and he will achieve his set target.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 28 years old. She is married and has three children who are between nine months and eight years old. Two of her children go to school. Her husband works at a government institution. Clarisse owns a butchery selling meat, and she has been in this business for a period of four years. 

She would like to get this loan to buy more meat to sell.  With the profit from this business, she expects to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.   In the future, she plans to expand her business and would like to see it prosper.

loans.use: To buy more meat to resell

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 45 years old. She is married to a pastor and has eight children who are between seven and twenty three years old. All her children go to school. Asia owns a hairdressing salon and has been doing this business for a period of four years. 

Asia requested this loan to buy more beauty products which will attract more ladies to use her salon.  She is planning to build a house from the profit that will be made  from this business. She dreams to own a house with two floors in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old. She is married and has one child, who is two months old. Her husband assists her in the business. Marie owns a boutique where she sells different products such as sugar, lotions, juice and cooking oil. 

She has requested a loan to add more items to her boutique. She believes that her business has done great things because she makes a profit. She hopes to buy a plot of land from the future profits. In the future, Marie would like to build a residential home.

loans.use: To buy more juice, lotions and sugar to sell

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Copo de Nieve” inicia su ciclo número 22  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, es un grupo antiguo que ya se conoce.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, 7 mujeres y 1 varón.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de abarrotes, venta de CD – DVD, costura, artesanía, venta de cosméticos y venta de comida rápida en un micro Snack. 

La señora Lucila, presidenta de la banca comunal indica que forma parte del B.C. “Copo de Nieve” gracias a la invitación de una amiga hace nueve años. Casada, madre de cuatro hijos, su negocio es la venta de productos en general en una tienda ubicada en una zona comercial de la zona de El Alto, desde hace 20 años atrás. Ella comenta que este negocio fue producto de su propia iniciativa. El primer crédito fue por Bs. 2000.-, ahora ha solicitado Bs.6000.- para la mejora de su tienda. Las ventas son realizadas todos los días durante todo el día, para esta labor tiene la ayuda de sus hijas.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es la capacitación en salud; tambien comenta que la atención del consultorio le parece buena.
texts.en:
The “Copo de Nieve” (Snowflake) Communal Bank initiated its 22nd loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), reporting to the Santiago II Office.  “Snowflake” is a very old group that is well known.  The bank is composed of 8 members, 7 of whom are women. The businesses they run are varied: selling groceries, selling CDs and DVDs, dressmaking, artisan work, selling cosmetics, and fast food sales in a micro snack shop.

Lucila, president of the communal bank, says she joined the bank thanks to an invitation from a girl friend some 9 years ago.  Married, the mother of 4 children, her business sells general merchandise in a store located in a commercial zone of El Alto, starting some 20 years back.  Lucila comments that this business was a product of her own initiative.  

Her 1st loan was for 2,000 Bolivars.  Now, she is requesting 6,000 Bolivars, to improve her store.  Her sales occur every day during the entire day.  To carry out the work she has the help of her daughters.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she commented 'the health training'; also, she said that the attention received in the consulting office is good.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence  is 27 years old. She is married and has a one-year-old child. Her husband works as a Credit Manager at the Popular Bank. Gaudence owns a small shop where she sells a variety of consumable goods such as cooking oil, soap, sugar and maize flour. 

She has requested this loan to buy additional merchandise and the profit will be used to expand a second shop she plans to set up. Gaudence's dream is to see the profits from her business double in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Mti-Pesa Group

texts.en:
Amri K. is in his early thirties, and is married with one daughter.  He has been a carpenter since 2008.  He makes furniture, such as chairs and tables.  He works from 7:30am to 6pm, and makes approximately $40 monthly profit.  Amri plans to use this loan to make a machine for leveling wood.

This will be his eighth loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his previous loans to purchase wood for his business.  Amri will share this loan with his group, Mti-Pesa, which has 21 members total.  The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the photo, Amri can be seen seated, second from the right, in a gray shirt.

loans.use: To make a machine for leveling wood

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Mariam S. is in her late twenties and has one child.  For the past two years, she has run a business purchasing vitenge (cloth), kangas (sarongs), and other second-hand clothing, selling it door-to-door.  She purchases her goods in the Kariakoo marketplace of Dar es Salaam and sells them in Arusha, in the north of Tanzania.  

She works from 8 am to 9 pm, and makes a monthly profit of more than $100.  Her dream is to one day open a store to sell her clothing so that she doesn't have to sell door-to-door.  

This will be Mariam's first loan with Kiva field partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will share the loan with her group, Dove, which has 15 members in total.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  Mariam can be seen in the photo in the center of the first row, seated, wearing orange and black.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge, kanga, and bed sheet to sell

loans.name: Morric Group

texts.en:
Paskali G. is in his late twenties and is married with children.  He has sold charcoal for 17 years.  He works from 6 am to 6 pm, and earns a monthly profit of about $67.  

This is Paskali's first Motisha loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  He will share the loan with other members of his group, Morric.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the photo, Paskali can be seen in the front on the left side, wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Najah

texts.ar:
نجاح في عمر 49 سنة نجاح تعمل في بيع الالبسة هي متزوجة ولها ولد لها في عملها اكثر من 7 سنوات
تحب عملها وهي تريد التجديد والتطوير في عملها حيث انها هي المعيل الوحيد للعائلة فزوجها لا يعمل تحب المثابرة على التطور تريد
عيش افضل لها ولعائلتها لم تجد صعوبة في التعامل مع المجموعة حيث كانت تلقى الدعم تريد اخذ قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء
بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع العمل
texts.en: Najah is a 49-year-old wife and mother of one who works in clothing retail. Since her spouse doesn’t work, she is the only breadwinner in the family, and accordingly she is very eager to provide them with a better life. After seven years in the field, Najah is dedicated to her work which she wants to further develop. Given that she has found Al Majmoua very supportive and easy to work with, she wanted to seek another loan to purchase new merchandise and further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise to expand business.

loans.name: Sammy Kitai Ole

texts.en:
Sammy Kitai N. is 45 years old. He is married and a father of four children who attend school.

He has a general store which he has been operating for the last four years on a busy street in Narok Town.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in the town. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy a motorbike to help him transport goods to the general store.
With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to open another shop and create employment for other people.

His future dream is that he will be able to build his own stand and his own house.
He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to help transport goods to the general store.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Felix Antonio P. M. tiene 25 anos. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1  hijo de 3 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Felix trabaja en la bananera como Paletizador y enfundador  en la hacienda, trabaja desde hace un año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Antonio P. M. is 25 years old.  His is in a common-law marriage, and he lives with his life partner and son.  They live in the Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos canton in the Los Ríos province,  He has a three year old child.

The members of the Dole 2 Communal Bank are agricultural workers.  They work on the Dole banana farm, which is located in the center of the canton.  All of the members live in the Ventanas Cantón.  Most of the members have worked on the farm for over one year, and their activities are related to the farm. There are approximately 13 members.

Felix works on the banana farm as a bag packer and pallet stacker.  He has worked there for one year.  He makes his purchases in the Cooperative Store 1 in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to put a business in his house, adapt the place, and buy products for his business.  The help from the loan will help him supply the necessities.  His dream is to improve his house and reach the goal of the business.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Business in his house and to adapt the place

loans.name: Tazara Maganga Group

texts.en:
Happiness M. is in her mid-twenties, and married with two children.  Since 2009, she has been selling vitenge (cloth), kangas (sarongs), and fruit door-to-door.  She works from 10 am to 5 pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $40.  

This will be Happiness' second loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loan to purchase bananas, mangoes, pineapple, vitenge and kangas.  It is her dream to one day open a food shop.  Happiness will share her loan with her group, Tazara Maganga, which has 24 members.  The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  

In the photo, Happiness can be seen in the front row, holding a child and wearing a yellow dress.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge, kangas, and fruit for resale

loans.name: Mabula Group

texts.en:
Charles M. is married with three children who attend school.  For the past five years, he has operated a fruit and vegetable stand, which earns him a profit of approximately $11 weekly.
