His shop is open from 11:30 am to 7:30 pm.  It is Charles' dream that his children attend college - this is very important to him.  Charles plans to use this current loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his stand.

This will be his fifth loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his previous loans to pay for household expenses, school fees, and home repairs.  Charles will share this loan with his group, M. Group, which has 15 members total.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the photo, Charles can be seen seated on the far right, wearing a white T-shirt with a blue design.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Luna Andina Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Luna Andina” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: elaboración y venta de buzos, costura de deportivos, elaboración de mantas,  venta de material de construcción.

La señora Carmen, presidenta de la banca comunal indica que forma parte del B.C. “Luna Andina” gracias a la invitación de una amiga; la señora Carmen es una persona con gran experiencia pues antes participó de otro banco comunal en Pro Mujer durante ocho años. Casada, actualmente está esperando su primer hijo, su negocio es la  elaboración y venta de poleras, en algunos casos para surtir la mercadería compra poleras.  Desarrolla este negocio desde hace 16 años atrás, comenta que sus hermanos mayores le enseñaron a coser poleras.  Las ventas son realizadas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo.
Su primer crédito hace varios años fue de Bs 800.-, ahora ha solicitado Bs2000.-, en esa oportunidad y ahora ese dinero será destinado a la compra de tela.
texts.en:
The “Luna Andina” (Andean Moon) community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office.  It is a new group which has formed to receive loan services, training and health services.  It has eight members whose businesses are varied: making and selling sweatshirts, sewing sports clothes, making blankets and selling building materials.

Carmen, the president of the bank, states that she it was a friend who invited her to become a member of the “Luna Andina” community bank.  Carmen is a woman of great experience since she was a member of another Pro Mujer community bank for eight years.  She is married and awaiting her first child.  Her business is making and selling t-shirts.  In some cases, to stock her business, she buys t-shirts.  She has been in this business for 16 years.  She comments that her older siblings taught her how to sew t-shirts.  She makes her sales in the '16 de Julio' (16th of July) market place on Thursdays and Sundays.

Her first loan several years ago was for 800 bolivianos.  She is now requesting 2,000 bolivianos.  This money will be used to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Bahati S. is in her early twenties, and married with one child.  She runs a business in the Kariakoo marketplace area of Dar es Salaam selling mobile phones, parts, SIM cards, and accessories.  She makes a daily profit of approximately $27.  Her business is open from 8 am to 6 pm daily.  

This will be Bahati's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her first loan to increase her business' capital.  She successfully repaid the first loan.  She would one day like to be able to travel to China to buy and sell wholesale phone supplies.  Bahati will share her loan with her group, Tamba, which has 21 members total.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  Bahati can be seen in the photo in the very front, wearing pink and white.

loans.use: To increase stock for mobile phone business

loans.name: Darwin Ismael

texts.es:
Darwin Ismael  T. T. tiene 28 anos. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1  hijo de 5 meses.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Darwin trabaja en la bananera como Paletizador y enfundador  en la hacienda, trabaja desde hace un año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Darwin Ismael T. T. is 28 years old. He lives in Union Libre with his partner and his son. He lives in the subdivision Ventanas in the Los Rios province. His son is five months old. 

The members of V.R.C. Dole 2 dedicate themselves to farming at the Dole banana plantation. All the members live in the Ventanas subdivision and the majority of them have worked at the plantation for more than a year. Their work is related to the banana plantation. There are approximately 13 members in the group. 

Darwin works at the banana plantation as a palletizer and sheather. He has been working there for a year and makes his purchases at the commissary in Ventanas. 

He is requesting this loan to establish a business in his home, to renovate the premises and to purchase products for his business. The support from this loan will help him economically to support his necessities. His dream is to improve his home and to meet the goal of his business. 

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To establish his business in his home and to renovate the premises.

loans.name: Said

texts.ar:
سعيد في عمر 51 سنة يعمل في ميكانيك السيارات متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته واولاده يعمل على                             
تأمين العيش الكريم لهم فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع للمحل وتكبير العمل                         
سعيد نشيط ويحب عمله فهو طموح يريد زيادة الانتاج في محله وتحسين وضع عائلته المادي له خبرة واسعة في مجال عمله                 
وله زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يريد بناء عائلته على اسسس مالية سليمة ومتينة
texts.en: Said is a 51-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and is trying to secure a dignified life for them. He is applying for a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase equipment to expand his auto mechanic business which is patronized by customers hailing from his neighbors and colleagues. Said is highly experienced and very passionate about his work and is driven to increase productivity so that he can put his family on firmer financiA. footing.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to expand business.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las trabajadoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita en fecha 18 de mayo de 2009,gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Lourdes G.,  quien se contactó con la asesora y actualmente se encuentran dentro del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
La presidenta del grupo es justamente la Sra.  Lourdes Giménez, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es la encargada de dirigir al grupo de manera a que todas cumplan a cabalidad como integrantes del comité, tanto para el pago como así también en cuanto a la disciplina que debe regir dentro del mismo. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sus mercaderías como remeras, shorts, blusas, vestidos, cosméticos.
texts.en:
This great group of women is called "Las Trabajadoras" which translates to "The Workers". The group was formed in the town of Ita on May 18, 2009 thanks to the current Director General Ms. Lourdes G. who contacted the consultant. The group is currently in the program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. The group is made up of 21 women who have worked very comfortably and are already in their 4th loan cycle, jointly and severally.
The president of the group is justly Ms. Lourdes G., who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for 2 years. She is married and has two children. She is responsible for leading the group so that everyone complies fully as members of the committee both in making payments as well as the discipline that should govern the committee.
She is requesting a loan to purchase their merchandise such as T-shirts, shorts, blouses, dresses and cosmetics.

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, shorts, shirts and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariana Hermelida

texts.es:
Mariana Hermelida C. G. tiene 38 años, es soltera, vive  con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo de 19 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Mariana  trabaja en la bananera como Desfloradora  de banano y en aplicación de fertilizantes en la hacienda, trabaja desde hace dos año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Mariana Hermelida Chavez Garcia is 38 years old. She is single and lives with her son in the Ventanas subdivision in the Los Rios province. Her son is 19 years old. 

The members of the V.R.C. Dole 2 dedicate themselves to agricultural labors at the Dole banana plantation. All the members live in the Ventanas subdivision and the majority of them have been working for more than a year at the plantation. Their work is related to the banana plantation. There are approximately 13 members in the group. 

Mariana works at the banana plantation deflorating the banana and applying fertilizers. She has worked there for two years. She makes her purchases at the commissary in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan to establish a business in her home, to make renovations to the premises and to purchase products for her business. The support from this loan will help her economically to support her needs. Her dream is to improve her home and to meet the goal of establishing her business. 

She enjoys cooking.

loans.use: To establish her business in her home and to renovate the premises.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El señor Cirilo vive en casa propia, en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos todos casados e independientes; Cirilo trabaja en la Alcaldía de Cota huma en el área de electricidad. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar productos de primera necesidad, como azúcar, arroz, harina, etc., ya que en la casa tiene instalada una tienda de abarrotes la cual atiende su esposa para aumentar los ingresos de su hogar.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Cirilo lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children, who are all married and independent.  Cirilo works as an electrician at the Cota Huma town hall.  He is asking for a loan to increase his capital and to buy staple products such as sugar, rice, flour, etc., since his wife runs a grocery store out of their home to increase the family's earnings.  

He is a client of Impro, he is very good with payments, and his social character qualifies him to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, etc., for his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señorita Esther vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como secretaria en una consultora; es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad.

El crédito que solicita es para inscribirse a la Universidad Tecnología Boliviana en la carrera de auditoria.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Esther lives with her parents in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  She works as a secretary in a law office.  She is 20, and single.

The loan that she is requesting is to register in the Universidad Tecnología Boliviana so that she can study and become an auditor.

This is the first time that she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and it is the first time that she is working through Kiva.  Because of her good reputation she qualifies to receive a loan.

loans.use: The cost of  the registration for the Universidad  Tecnología Boliviana so that she can study and become an auditor.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي في عمر 52 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في مجال كهرباء السيارات هو نشيط ومجد يحب عائلته ويتمنى لها افضل                  
حياة فهو محب للعيش الكريم فهو يهدف من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع منزله وتجديده ليصبح امن اكثر لأولاده            
يلقى دائما دعم من عائلته له خبرة كبيرة في عمله زبائنه جيرانه ومحبيه واصدقائه فهو مثابر على اجاد لقمة العيش والعيش      الكريم له ولعائلته
texts.en: Ali is a 52-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and in turn is loved by them. He persistently seeks to provide them with enough victuals and a better and more dignified life. For many years, he has been working very hard as an automotive electrical engineer, with his patronage coming from neighbors, friends, and loved ones. Ali is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua for home improvements to make his domicile more secure for his children.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “El Sol Brilla para Todos” perteneciente a  la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella confecciona buzos, poleras, otros productos por encargos y hace composturas (arreglos), desde hace 10 años, en su casa. Tiene como clientes frecuentes 3 colegios, algunos jardines infantiles,  además de clientes particulares. Durante todo el año trabaja sola, pero los meses de enero y febrero contrata a una persona para que le ayude, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de colegios. Con este préstamo comprará una máquina de coser industrial, que es lo que le hace falta ahora, a pesar de tener actualmente 4 máquinas para diferentes usos. 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ampliar el espacio de su taller y abarcar a más clientes. 
Adriana está muy agradecida de la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza, tanto por los préstamos, como por los talleres sobre administración de negocios.  El taller que más le ha servido hasta ahora  fue el que le enseñó a registrar sus gastos y ganancias en un cuaderno de contabilidad, ya que de esta manera está organizando mejor su tiempo y dinero.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los bellos parajes y patios que posee. Se encuentra en la región de Valparaíso. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Adriana is part of The “El Sol Brilla para Todos” (The Sun Shines for Everyone) Communal Bank in the city of Viña del Mar. She has been working from home for over ten years making track suits, T-shirts and other items by order as well as making alterations. Amongst her steady clients are three schools, some kindergartens and individual clients. During the year she works alone, but in January and February she hires another person to help her because she receives many orders from schools at this time of year. 

With this loan she will purchase an industrial sewing machine. This is what she needs right now, even though she has four other sewing machines, which she uses for other work. Her goal is to continue expanding her business and increase both her workshop space and her client base.

Adriana is very grateful for the help from Fondo Esperanza, both for the loans they provide her and for the workshops, which they run regarding business administration. The workshop that has helped her the most up until now was the workshop that taught her how to record her expenditures and income in an accounts book, which has helped her to better organize both her time and her money.

Viña del Mar is both a city and a commune located in the region of Valparaíso on the central coast of Chile. It is known as the Garden City because of its beautiful places and courtyards and is considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: Industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José M. Z. tiene 20 años, Vive en Unión Libre, vive  con los abuelos y la esposa y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Juan  trabaja en la bananera como pesador de banano, trabaja desde hace tres año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan José M. Z. is 20 years old.  He lives with his partner, his grandparents and his son.  He lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  He has 1 son. 

The members of the communal bank V.R.C. Dole 2 make their livings in agricultural work on the DOLE banana hacienda, which is located in the seat of the Canton.  All of the members live in Ventanas Canton.  The majority of the members have worked for more than a year at the previously mentioned hacienda, and their businesses are connected to bananas.  There are approximately 13 members.

Juan has worked weighing bananas for three years.  He makes his purchases in the Comisariato (Market) 1 in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to start a business out of his home, to adapt his premises to the business and to purchase products for his business.  The loan will help him to fulfill his financial needs.  His dreams are to improve his house and to reach his business goals.
He likes sports.

loans.use: To start a business out of his home, to adapt his premises to the business and to purchase products for his business.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro vive en alquiler en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como profesor en un colegio fiscal, soltero vive con su madre.

El crédito que solicita es para realizar un examen medico a su rodilla porque al ir al trabajo se cayó y no puede caminar. Por tanto necesita urgente una revisión, y poder asistir con normalidad a su fuente de trabajo. 

Por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro lives in a rental property in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He works as a teacher at a public school. Alejandro is single and lives with his mother.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for a medical exam on his knee because he fell while going to work and is not able to walk. For this reason, he needs urgent medical attention so that he can resume his job.

His social character qualifies him for this loan.

loans.use: Pay for a medical exam

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto V. M. tiene 31 años, Es soltero, vive  con los abuelos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Jorge  trabaja en la bananera como destallador y selector de banano, trabaja desde hace tres año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.

Le gusta comer frutas.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto V. M. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his grandparents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has one child.

The members of the VRC Dole 2 Communal Bank are farm laborers who work at the Dole banana plantation in the capital of the canton. All of the members live in the canton of Ventanas. Most of the members have worked on the plantation for more than a year and their activities are related to cultivating bananas. There are approximately 13 members.

Jorge works on the plantation as a pruner and fruit picker. He has been employed there for three years. Jorge buys what he needs at the #1 commissary in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to establish a business in his home. Jorge plans to equip his store and buy products for his business. With the help of this loan, he will be able to meet his needs financially. His dream is to improve his home and complete his goal of having a business.

Jorge enjoys eating fruit.

loans.use: Operating capital to start a business in his home

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer vive en alquiler con su señora madre en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Soltero, no tiene hijos. Tiene un auto con el cual trabaja en transporte libre de pasajeros, generando así sus ingresos.  Algunas veces repara maquinas fotocopiadoras para ayudarse en sus ingresos.

 El crédito que solicita es para reparar su auto y comprar una batería, para de esta manera mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Wilmer lives in a rental property with his mother in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is single and does not have children. Wilmer has an automobile that he uses for work. He transports passengers as a means of generating income. In addition, he sometimes repairs photocopying machines to help earn extra money.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair his automobile and purchase a battery so that he can maintain its stability for his work.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from IMPRO. His social character qualifies him for this loan.

loans.use: Purchase a battery & pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Ángel Rodolfo

texts.es:
Ángel Rodolfo E. M. tiene 33 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive  con la compañera y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Angel trabaja en la bananera como calificador y colocador de cintas de banano, trabaja desde hace dos año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Ángel Rodolfo E. M. is 33 years old, in a common law marriage with his companion, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has one child.

The members of the VRC Dole 2 Communal Bank are farm laborers who work at the Dole banana plantation in the capital of the canton. All of the members live in the canton of Ventanas. Most of the members have worked on the plantation for more than a year and their activities are related to cultivating bananas. There are approximately 13 members.

Ángel works on the plantation as an inspector and is responsible for placing stickers on the bananas. He has been employed there for two years. Ángel buys what he needs at the #1 commissary in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to establish a business in his home. Ángel plans to equip his store and buy products for his business. With the help of this loan, he will be able to meet his needs financially. His dream is to improve his home and complete his goal of having a business.

Ángel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Initial capital to start a business in his home

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Arco Iris” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de camas, venta de material de construcción, tienda de barrio, confección de camisas, costura en general, tienda de carnicería, venta de papa, venta de refrescos, albañilería – construcción.
 
La señora Antonia presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que forma parte del B.C. “Arco Iris” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud.  La señora Antonia aprendió a costurar desde muy joven en una fábrica, actualmente hace costura de trajes formales de dama, por ahora recibe cortes y ella hace la costura.  El crédito solicitado es para hacer arreglar su máquina de coser.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es el ahorro y compartir en grupo.
texts.en:
The “Arco Iris” (Rainbow) Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This is a new group that was formed so that it could receive credit services, training, and health care. The group consists of eight members who are involved in various business such as selling beds, selling construction materials, operating a neighborhood store, manufacturing shirts, sewing, operating a butcher shop, selling potatoes, selling soft drinks, and masonry and construction.

Sra. Antonia is the president of the Communal Bank. She says she joined the “Arco Iris” Communal Bank because of an invitation she received from the promoters of Pro Mujer who came to her area to raise awareness of the credit, training, and health services. Sra. Antonia learned to sew as a young woman by working at a factory. She currently produces women’s formal wear, but now receives orders for traditional clothing. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her sewing machine.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Antonia said she enjoys the savings and the ability to share with her group.

loans.use: Pay for sewing machine repairs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a thirty-two year old married man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is seeing his children go to school and graduate since he did not have a chance to further his education.

 For ten years now, Emmanuel has been in the motorcycle transport business  and this has helped him  to earn money to pay fees for his children although he still has a challenge of high expectations from his boss, thus limiting his daily income.

In his dreams he really longs to have his own motorcycle as the motorcycle owner takes 70% of the daily income. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his own transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo vive en alquiler, en la zona de Cusi cancha de la ciudad de La Paz, soltero, no tiene hijos y vive solo.

Guillermo tiene un taller de mecánica en la zona de Tembladerani, con esta actividad el se mantiene y cubre todas sus necesidades, además cuenta con dos empleados; el crédito que solicita es para comprar una gata Hidráulica y poder mantener a su clientela ya que por la falta de herramientas pierde clientes.

Por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo lives alone in a rental property in the District of Cusi Cancha in the city of La Paz. He is single and does not have chidlren.

Guillermo has an auto repair shop in the District of Tembladerani. His business has been maintained and meets all of his needs. In addition, he has two employees. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a hydraulic jack. This will allow him to maintain his clientele and prevent losing customers due to a lack of equipment.

His social character qualifies him for this loan.

loans.use: Purchase a hydraulic jack

loans.name: Velonique

texts.en:
Velonique is 54 years old. She has four children who are between 26 and 39 years old. All her children attend school. Her husband works as a technician at the national sewage company. Velonique sells charcoal and she has had this business for three years. 

She has requested this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She believes that her business has allowed her to cover most of her basic needs and the neighbors have significantly benefited from her business. The profit from this business will be used to help her to raise the tuition fee for her children to complete university studies. She hopes to make a continuous profit in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Julia Cruz

texts.es:
Julia de 68 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Hace 35 años por el sector donde vivía no existía ninguna tienda o lugar donde comprar víveres fue por ello que ella decidió tener la primera tienda del sector para tener ingresos y poder mantener a su familia y darle una oportunidad a sus vecinos donde comprar. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. Para seguir con el negocio y surtir más su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, arroz, dulces, enlatados. 

Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es que quiere que su tienda este mas surtida y grande, también quiere comercializar pollos para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Julia, age 68, sells provisions from a store in the front part of her house. She lives in an area called Suburbio de Guayquil where most of the residents work as merchants.

Thirty five years ago, this area did not have a store or any other place to buy provisions. For this reason Julia decided to open the first store in the area so that she could earn income, support her family, and provide her neighbors with the opportunity to buy things. She currently works at her store from 8am until 4pm selling rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, and other products. To keep her business running and restock her store with more inventory, Julia wants to use this loan to buy beverages, rice, candy, and canned goods.

Her aspirations for the future include having a larger well-stocked store. She also wants to sell chickens to earn additional income.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, rice, candy, and canned goods

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira, a talented lady, supports her family by sewing for neighborhood customers. A resident of Kamoki, Pakistan, a city famous for its rice industry, she lives there in the area named Hajveri Muhallah in a two-room brick house with her family.

Sabira, the mother of two sons and three daughters, is married to M. I., who operates a laundry business that provides both washing and pressing services. He has been in business for over 10 years, and his shop is located in a nearby market. Their elder son helps his father in the business, while their elder daughter does sewing works and assists Sabira in filling orders on time. The remaining children are enrolled in school.

Sabira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy an iron and washing products such as surf and bleach and provide better services to his clients. Sabira is hopeful that this investment will be productive and earn him more income.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is Sabira's fourth loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in previous loan years and attended every meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sabira.

loans.use: To buy an iron & washing products for laundry business

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las Luchadoras se denomina el excelente grupo donde la Directora General  es la Sra.  Cristina G., quien tiene una despensa hace 3 años está casada tiene 7 hijos, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la  Fundación Paraguaya.
La Señora Cristina se siente muy contenta con su grupo y asegura que seguirá trabajando con el comité. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa como, harina, fideos, arroz, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
“Las Luchadoras” (The Fighters) is known for being an excellent group. Sra. Cristina G. serves as its General Director. She has managed a food pantry for three years and is married with seven children. Cristina contacted an advisor at one of the weekly meetings held in her area about how she could join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. After learning about the program, she was able to gather 16 women who enjoy working and now they are in their first loan cycle. They work together in the program as a single unit. All of the members participate in fundraising activities so that they can reach the common goals they share with one another and with Fundación Paraguaya.

Sra. Cristina is very happy with her group and says that she will continue working with her committee. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her food pantry such as flour, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase flour, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Cristal 1 Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “CRISTAL I” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: tejido de mantas y chompas, trenzado de mantas, venta en kiosco de refrescos y otros, artesanìas tienda de barrio, venta de láminas – periódicos – letreros, venta de láminas de plancha (láminas metálicas. 
La señora Juana presidenta de la banca comunal indica que forma parte del B.C. “Cristal I” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud.  La señora Juana tiene como negocio la elaboración de “bouquet de novia”, inició este negocio hace 10 años siguiendo el consejo de su cuñada, también piensa en ampliar sus ingresos con la venta de edredones y productos de belleza para las fiestas de fin de año. El negocio de elaboración y venta de “bouquet de novia” es a pedido, de acuerdo a la demanda que hacen las tiendas especializadas en venta de vestidos y accesorios para novias; cuando es necesario sus hijos de 18 y 17 años le ayudan en el armado de los los “bouquet de novia”.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es el ahorro, la capacitación y la atención en salud en el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cristal 1” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. It is a new group that formed in order to receive credit services, training, and health care. The group consists of eight members. The businesses in which the members work are varied: weaving blankets and sweaters, managing a refreshment kiosk, operating a neighborhood craft store, selling paper goods (including individual sheets, newspapers, and posters), and selling sheets of metal.

Sra. Juana is the president of the Communal Bank. She says she joined the Cristal 1 Communal Bank after being invited by the promoters of Pro Mujer who came to her area to raise awareness about the credit, training, and health services. Sra. Juana has a business making bridal bouquets. She started this business ten years ago based on the advice of her sister-in-law. Juana also plans to increase her earnings by selling bedspreads and beauty products during the year-end holidays. Her business of making and selling bridal bouquets is conducted based on orders she receives from specialty stores that sell formalwear and accessories to brides. When necessary, her children (ages 18 and 17) help with the assembly of the bridal bouquets.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Julia replied that she enjoys the savings, the training, and the health services she receives at the clinic.

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads & beauty products to sell during the holidays

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia M. A. is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is a very active and supportive lady. She has given birth to two daughters and two sons. Her first two children are enrolled in school and getting their education while the younger ones are younger than four years of age. 

Razia has applied for a loan for her husband’s cosmetics shop. He sells ladies' cosmetic products. He rents the shop, which is located in the busy market. With the loan, he will buy a variety of cosmetics products such as foundation, eye shadow, mascara and blusher for selling through his shop. The cosmetic products will allow him to offer more variety to his customers and make more sales and income. He has been in this business for the past 10 years and Razia is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for his business.
 
Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; La socia tiene 50 años de edad, el es divorciado y tiene 1 hijos, la socia tiene un pequeño bazar ella vende todo tipo de productos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde; la socia vende regalos, ella ofrece desde cofres para guardar aretes y joyería, hasta peluches, muñecas, adornos y mucho mas. La socia invertirá su dinero en la compra de mercadería, ella comprara regalos y adornos para la época navideña.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar regalos y adornos para la época navideña. 

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Hijos de Qolquewasi” (The Children of Qolquewasi), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 50 years old, divorced, and has one child. Doris manages a small bazaar where she sells all types of products between the hours of 8am and 6pm. She sells gifts which include jewelry boxes for storing earrings and other keepsakes to stuffed toys, dolls, decorations, and many other items. Doris wants to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the holiday season, so she will use the proceeds from the loan she requested to buy gifts and decorations.

She appreciates and values the loan that is being provided to her, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase gifts & decorations for the holiday season

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natalia; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, ella es soltera, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella invertirá su crédito en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y comprara arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, harinas y todo al por mayor; La socia desea el crédito para cubrir sus necesidades económicas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi" ["The Children of Qolquewasi"] communal bank.  Her communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Natalia.  She is 38 years old, single, and has a small grocery store.  She will invest her loan in the wholesale purchase of staple products like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.  She would like this loan in order to cover her economic needs.

Ms. Natalia is grateful for and values the loan being offered to her here.  She also promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy staple goods like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife who performs her household duties by staying at home. She has 2 sons and a daughter. Razia has spent most of her life in poverty.  She was unable to educate her children, who left school without completing an education. Her elder son works in a factory for a low income. Her second son has skills, and makes shoes for a living.  H takes orders from different shoe factories and finishes these orders on time to earn an income.  Razia’s daughter does sewing  for her neighboring clients to contribute her family financially. 

Razia's husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant and offers variety of food and tea to his clients. He has good customer service skills.  Because of the quality of his food, he is able to attract many customers to his restaurant. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, her husband will buy items such as cooking oil, lentils, rice and spices in bulk  to make food to sell.  Razia is hopeful that this investment will make her husband’s restaurant business more profitable. 
She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. With her previous loans, Razia always paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting. 

In the photo, the woman holding the book (called Asasah Passbook ) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy items in bulk for a restaurant business

loans.name: Angela Lastenia

texts.es:
Ángela de 54 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura en la sala de su casa. Vive con su esposo en una zona  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Hace 10 años atrás ella comenzó con su taller de confección y costura porque le gustaba realizar esta actividad y también ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo. Comenzó con una máquina de coser pero por el buen trabajo que ha venido realizando ha podido comprar tres maquinas. Su trabajo lo realiza a cualquier hora ya que su taller de costura lo tiene en la sala de su casa ya que no tiene un local fijo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y rollos de hijos para confeccionar más ropa y tener a la venta para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando como confeccionista y tener dinero para hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela is 54 years old.  She has a dressmaking and sewing workshop in her living room.  She lives with her husband in an area which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are traders and salesmen.  The area is called Guayaquil.

10 years ago she set up her dressmaking and sewing workshop because she liked the work and also to help her husband with family expenses.  She started out with one sewing machine but because of the good work which she has been doing she has been able to buy three machines.  She does her work at any time because her sewing workshop is in the living room of her home as she doesn't have a fixed business premises.

She would like to use the loan to buy fabric and rolls of thread to make more clothes to sell to her customers.  In the future, she would like to continue working as a dressmaker and have money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: Fabric, rolls of thread

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y de sus jóvenes hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa casual y calzado, en diferentes modelos y colores de acuerdo a la temporada. Este negocio le gusta mucho, ya que la convierte en una mujer independiente y durante este tiempo ha logrado captar buena clientela, entre amigos y conocidos que le compran constantemente a crédito, asimismo lleva su mercadería a una mina donde vende muy bien a los trabajadores; su gran carisma y la gran capacidad de persuasión le ha permitido vender y colocar los productos que ofrece, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias económicas. La mercadería que tiene es traída de la ciudad capital, aumentando su precio inicial, de esa manera, por tal razón se siente muy satisfecha, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es continuar en este rubro, y mas adelante instalar un negocio en algún puesto dentro de un centro comercial. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y también en abrir su granja.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her young children.  For 3 years she has been selling casual clothes and footwear in different styles and colors according to the season.  She likes her business a lot since it makes her an independent woman.  Over time, she has managed to attract a good group of customers, friends and acquaintances who buy from her constantly on credit.  She also takes her merchandise to a mine where she sells very well to the workers.  Her great charisma and gift of persuasion have allowed her to sell the products which she offers, making very good financial profits.  The merchandise she has is brought from the capital city, increasing its initial price.  She feels very satisfied since she can help her husband cover their household expenses.  Her greatest wish is to continue in this activity and, further down the line, set up her business on a stall in a shopping center.

This is Juana's second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those people who will fund her loan as it will help her a to make progress in her business.  She will invest the loan in buying more merchandise and also in opening a farm.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to have in stock.  To set up a farm

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia vive en casa propia en la zona Pura Pura, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su  su hijo; es madre soltera. Claudia es empleada de una tienda de venta de joyas de fantasía, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene; el crédito que solicita será utilizado en la refacción de la fachada de la casa y el colocado de una puerta principal de entrada
Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, pues se la considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in her own home in Pura Pura district, in the city of La Paz with her child.  She is a single mother.  Claudia works in a shop selling costume jewelry.  She uses her income to support herself.  This loan will be used to refurbish the front of her house and to install a main entrance door.

Her background qualifies her to obtain a new loan since she is considered a good client.

loans.use: To refurbish the front of her house and install a front door

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children; four of them are in school.  She also takes care of her father.    

Janet sells secondhand bed sheets and mattress covers  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days a week, retailing her  products in a shop.  Janet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of bed sheets and mattress covers. Janet's main business challenges for Janet include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to buy a plot of land.   Janet lives in a home that she rents.  She doesn't have access to electricity or  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of bed sheets and mattress covers

loans.name: Naghma's Group

texts.en:
Naghma lives in Kamoki, a small city in Pakistan known for its rice industry. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in the neighborhood of Hajvery Muhallah.

Naghma is married to M. A., who is a cobbler by profession. He supplies shoes to different factories and shoe-selling shops on order. He has been doing this work for more than 20 years and is an expert with a good number of clients. 

Naghma is the mother of seven children: four daughters and three sons. Her two elder sons help their father in his business. Because of financial constraints, these two were unable to get an education. Three of her other five children are able to attend school, and the remaining two children stay at home. 

Naghma is a housewife who stays at home. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will purchase leather, thread, and shoe polish in bulk quantity to fulfill larger orders on time and to earn a good income. Naghma is hopeful that this loan will help her husband to increase his profits by making a larger quantity of shoes to supply to shops and factories. She is a regular borrower from Asasah, and this is her third loan application. With her previous loans, she has paid her installments on time and has attended every meeting.  

In the photo, Naghma is the woman holding the book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy leather and other shoe-making supplies

loans.name: Eyra De La Soledad

texts.es: Eyra  tiene 59 años. La actividad económica es la venta de cerdos y gallina. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio por su esposo ya que anteriormente ella se hacía cargo y por no dejar inactivo el negocio le dijo propuso a su esposa que continuara con el negocio. Los propósitos de ella para su negocio son de ofrecer buena calidad en sus animales para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo comprar cerdos y gallinas y al mismo tiempo el alimento de estos animales. El sueño de Eyra es ampliar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Eyra is 59 years old.  Her business is selling pigs and hens.  She has been in this business for more than 8 years.  She started this business because of her husband.  He used to be in charge of the business and, in order not to leave it inactive, he suggested to his wife that she take it over.  Her suggestions for the business are to offer good quality animals in order to gain more customers.  The loan will be used as working capital to buy pigs and hens and, at the same time, feed for these animals.  Eyra's dream is to expand her small business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
K. Damalie is a 36-year-old ebullient married mother of 5 who has been teaching for the last 6 years in the Kitatya primary school Kayunga.  

She began teaching immediately after she finished her teaching course. Damalie also does some modest farming and she says in the near future she is anticipating opening up a beauty salon. This, she says will go a long way in helping her increase her disposable income. At present, she earns a salary of 260,000 shillings.  With this loan, she says she is going to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Gladys Haydee

texts.es:
Gladys de 27 años, tiene una pequeña papelería, Vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en una zona  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Escogió tener una papelería porque su hijo pequeño necesitaba tener una mejor viva económica ya que su ex esposo no le daba dinero para sustentar las necesidades de su hijo. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar diversa papelería hasta que se volvió a casar e incremento su papelería. En la actualidad tiene ya cuatro hijos uno de 13, 11, 9 y 4 años también trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.00, plumas, lápices, papelería etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería y otros artículos para su papelería. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y si es posible agrandarlo más con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old.  She has a small stationery store.  She lives with her husband and 4 children in an area characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are traders and salesmen.  The area is the suburb of Guayaquil.

Gladys chose to have a stationery store because her young son needed to have better financial support as her ex-husband didn't give her money to support him.  Little by little, with effort, she was able to buy various stationery products until she re-married and increased her stationery business.  She currently has four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 4.  She also works from very early in the morning selling $1.00 exercise books, pens, pencils, stationery, etc.

She would like to use her loan to buy exercise books, pens, stationery and other articles for her stationery store.  In the future, she would like to continue with her business and, if possible, expand it with more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy stationery, exercise books..

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
El señor Alan es  soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en anticretico junto a su madre ya que su padre se alejo de la familia, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Fátima barrio Petrolero de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene 23 años; después de titularse en la Universidad, trabajará como abogado en un buffet, actualmente es egresado de la carrera de derecho y la especialización dura un año.

El crédito lo utilizará para pagar su matricula en la universidad Andina, y trabaja actualmente como auxiliar en la corte suprema de justicia. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Alan is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in anticretico (a special rental system offered in Bolivia) with his mother since his father left the family.  Their house is located in Villa Fátima district, in the Petrolero neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Alan is 23 years old.  After graduating from University, he will work as a lawyer in a lawyer's office.  He has currently completed his law degree and his specialization course will last a year.

He will use his loan to register at the Universidad Andina.  He currently works as an assistant in the Supreme Court which is how he makes income for his household.

This is Alan's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: Cost of registering at the Universidad Andina to pursue a specialization course

loans.name: Aleman Florida Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Alemán Florida” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de ropa de segunda mano, compra venta de ovejas, venta de coca, tienda de barrio, venta de arena, viaje a provincia llevando fruta, venta de fruta, venta de cordero. Esta banca comunal esta dirigida por una mesa directiva entusiasta que pueso a su banco comunal el nombre de la zona en la que viven. 

La señora Francisca cumple el rol de tesorera de la banca comunal, esta casada, tuvo un hijo, quien ahora ya tiene su propio hogar.  Indica que forma parte del B.C. “Aleman Florida” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud.  La señora Francisca tiene como negocio la venta de ropa de segunda mano, en la zona 12 de Octubre, todos los días en la tarde.  Inició este negocio hace 4 años viendo a otros negociantes y como hacen el negocio de compra – venta.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Alemán Florida” community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office.  It is a new group which has formed to receive loan services, training and health services.  It has eight female members.  The women's businesses are varied: selling used clothes, buying and selling sheep, selling coca, neighborhood store, selling sand, travelling out of town to sell fruit, selling fruit and selling lamb.  This community bank is led by an enthusiastic executive committee which has given the bank the name of the district where they all live.

Francisca is the bank's treasurer.  She is married and has one child who now has their own home.  She tells us that she joined the “Alemán Florida” community bank after being invited to do so by the Pro Mujer promoters who came to her district to let people know about their loan services, training and health services.  Francisca's business is selling used clothes in the 12 de Octubre district every afternoon.  She started this business 4 years ago as she watched other traders and saw how they carried out their buying and selling businesses.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that it was the training sessions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; tiene 50 años de edad, y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales llamada Herbalife que vende en forma independiente y también lo vende con su hija y lo llevan a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos naturales. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de naturales al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gloria is 50 years old.  She is a widow and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling natural products called Herbalife.  She sells independently and also sells with her daughter.  They take their products to different places such as institutions and the general public.  She would like to have a store where she can sell natural products.  She is requesting this loan to buy natural products wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy natural products wholesale

loans.name: Ashley

texts.en:
Ashley H. is the executive director of the Capital Area Phoenix Initiative, a non-profit start-up that addresses the overwhelming need in Baton Rouge for HIV/AIDs services. Ashley is currently employed by the Public Health Department as a Disease Intervention Specialist. Whenever a person tests positive for a disease, a specialist visits that person to follow up, conduct an interview, and refer him or her to an agency. With Baton Rouge being the city with the second highest ratio of people with HIV/AIDS in the United States, Ashley realized that the current agencies were overwhelmed. While she has been working at her current job, she is also studying for her PhD in Public Health at Waldon University, applying for funding for her non-profit, and completing the extensive application to qualify for non-profit status. As soon as she attains enough funding, Ashley plans on resigning from her current job and completely dedicating herself to starting the Capital Area Phoenix Initiative. 

Ashley decided to start this non-profit because on a daily basis, she witnesses how challenging it is to navigate the medical system, especially with an isolating condition like HIV/AIDS. This non-profit will help clients apply for Medicaid, insurance, food stamps, and find counseling and support. Furthermore, Ashley is dedicated to educating the public about the prevention of HIV/AIDS as well, which differentiates her agency from others. Once Ashley finishes her certification for Medicaid at the end of November, she will be able to start taking referrals and working with clients. 

Ashley plans on hiring six employees in the beginning to help her accomplish the tri-fold vision of her business: outreach and prevention, case management, and ultimately, a free clinic. Her goal is to open her doors on World AIDS day on Dec. 5th to offer free AIDS testing. Aside from applying for non-profit status, Ashley’s biggest challenge was finding a space for an office that would be located within a larger building so that clients could enter the building without fear of being noticed. Ashley is very proud that she found the perfect location after looking for quite a while. 

With this loan, Ashley plans on buying office equipment and signs. Ashley’s motivation is unstoppable because “I want to be a better person and be more humble about helping others. That’s my goal in life. This infection could happen to anybody at any time. It doesn’t differentiate between race, age, or gender. My goal is to prevent more people from getting this.”

loans.use: Office equipment and signs

loans.name: Aquelina

texts.es: Aquelina tiene 35 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, su esposo se encuentra fuera del país. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra regularmente papa y maíz; mercadería que es llevada a vender en los mercados principales de su ciudad. Su gran ventaja es que posee terrenos propios donde sembrar, además cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y de sus hijos, quienes ya adultos siempre la apoyan a su mama. Sin embargo cuando se requiere de un trabajo más intenso tanto en la siembra como la cosecha tiene que contratar peones. Afirma que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura porque le permite tener alimentos disponibles para su propio consumo, además de que en estas últimas cosechas ha recuperado lo invertido, es por eso que desea mejorar la producción y optar por otros cultivos más rentables. Es su tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Además agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Aquelina is 35 years old.  She lives with her 4 children in her own home.  Her husband is out of the country.  She has been farming for 15 years.  She regularly grows potatoes and corn.  She takes her produce to the main markets of her city to sell.  Her great advantage is that she has her own land where she grows her crops.  She also has the support of her family and her children who are already adults and always support their mom.  However, when she has a lot of hard work both in sowing and in harvesting she contracts laborers.  Aquelina tells us that she likes to farm because it allows her to have food available for her own consumption.  She has also been able to recoup what she invested in her latest harvests.  This is why she would like to improve her production and chose other more profitable crops to grow.

This is Aquelina's third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is also grateful to everybody who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful for her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of fertilizer and seeds for her next sowing season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato and corn seeds for the next sowing season

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era muy pequeña, esta trabajadora mujer se dedicaba a la agricultura, hoy la siembra de maíz, arveja y papa, son una de sus principales actividades. Le gusta mucho su labor de campo, esta muy acostumbrada a levantarse muy temprano para dirigirse a sus campos y cuidar de sus cultivos, ya que sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación puede  producir en abundancia. Por otro lado, cuenta con clientes fijos, que siempre le compran la mercadería, una vez cosechada y llevada a los mercados, de esa manera se genera buenas ganancias que le alcanza y aporta en la economía de su familia, además de poder tanto ella como su esposo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Como es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene pensado en el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad para que pueda vender más. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y abono para su temporada de siembra .
texts.en:
Bertha, age 38, lives with her husband and their two children in her own house.  Ever since she was very small this hard-working woman has been farming.  She now grows corn, peas, and potatoes.  The crops are her main business activity.  She really likes to work in the fields.  She is very used to getting up very early to go to the fields and taking care of her crops.  She knows that with much effort and dedication she is able to produce in abundance.

She has fixed customers who always buy her merchandise once it is harvested and taken to the markets.  This is the way that she generates good income, which contributes to the family financially.  Also, she and her husband are able to give their children a better quality of life.

As she is a hard-working woman, in the future she plans to plant more in order to be able to sell more.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank, where all of the members are responsible and very supportive.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the planting season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for corn, peas, and potatoes for the next planting season

loans.name: Zzana Victory Development Group-Kampala

texts.en:
N. Rebecca, 48, a member of  Zzana Victory Development Group - Kampala, has been driving a roaring trade operating a poultry business for the last decade in Zzana. Like many other boisterous suburbs surrounding Kampala, Zzana is a trading center where chicken roasting is commonplace and a highly lucrative business venture that many people are rushing to enter. 

Previously a nurse in the civil service, Rebecca, a happily married mother of four, says she is a lady with willpower who in most instances relies on her beliefs for motivation. As part of her poultry business she sells eggs, and she also garners some side income from a drug store business, in total earning 120,000 shillings in weekly profits. With this loan, she is going to purchase mash for her layer chickens.

loans.use: The purchase of chicken mash for layer chickens

loans.name: Ernesto Ricardo

texts.es:
Ernesto de 63 años, tiene un puesto de venta de carnes y lactaos es viudo con 5 hijos ya mayores de edad. Vive en una zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

El vivía en una finca pero por razones sentimentales tuvo que abandonarla e ir a la ciudad de Guayaquil con su hermana para trabajar en una tienda de carnes en el centro de la ciudad. Luego de algunos años el decidió independizarse y tener su propio negocio de venta de pollos y lácteos. En la actualidad ya tiene 25 años con su negocio de venta de pollos en un mercado trabaja en la mañana hasta las 12h00 vendiendo los pollos y en las tardes en la parte delantera de su casa tiene un puesto. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes de chancho, pollos, vaca y lácteos para tener una mayor variedad para sus clientes. En los próximos 5 años el quiere continuar con sus negocios para darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernesto, age 63, has a stand where he sells meat and dairy products.  He is a widower, and he has five grown children.  He lives in a zone that is considered to be a suburb of Guayaquil, and most of its inhabitants work as informal traders.

He lived on a farm, but for sentimental reasons he had to leave the farm and go to the city of Guayaquil to work with his sister.  They worked in a meat store in the center of the city.  As the years passed he decided to become independent and have his own business selling chickens and dairy products.  

He has now had the business of selling chickens in a market for 25 years.  He works selling chickens in the morning until 12:00.  In the afternoons he works in the front part of his house where he has a stand.

He wants to use the loan to buy pork, chicken, beef, and dairy products in order to have a greater variety for his customers.  In the next five years he wants to continue with his businesses in order to give his children a better life.

loans.use: Meat and dairy products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa Gloria C. enjoyed her job at a daycare enough to want her own.  So she started studying and earned her Associate’s degree in child development.  At the same time, she started up her day care out of her own home, serving children under 13.  It was successful enough that she expanded in 2007 from a space for 12 children to one for 33.  Now she and her seven employees provide care, a curriculum of classes year-round, and a food program.

In the last few years, Elsa has been struggling financially due to the economic downturn.  Unemployed parents had to pull their children from daycare, so her enrollment dropped.  Thankfully, this past year enrollment has started to improve again.  Elsa took out this loan to improve her building, so that the children would be better cared for and safer.  For example, she plans to do some maintenance on the building and add air conditioning, security cameras, and a small roof over the patio for the children.

Elsa dedicates her life to her three children and four grandchildren.  Her daycare has enabled her to provide for them through the years.  Now, her two older sons help her out with the daycare as she needs it, and her 19-year old daughter is employed there as a caregiver.

Elsa’s greatest success is achieving her Associate’s degree, despite difficulty understanding English.  Not to mention raising her children and starting her business.

After Elsa’s divorce, she found it easy to think negatively. It caused her financial difficulties.  Now, with the loan, her faith and confidence to move forward have returned.  Elsa plans to continually improve her daycare and the service she offers.  She would like to add classes in more topics, such as music.  She is also working to improve her English.

Her suggestion to other small business owners is to “get advice. It makes a difference. You never know if you don’t ask.”

loans.use: Day care building improvements

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur  Alioune N. est un pêcheur  de 37 ans. Il habite à Yoff. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 7 ans. Monsieur N. exerce l’activité de pêcheur  depuis 1989 après avoir quitté l’école primaire. C’est une activité qui lui a été recommandé par son père. Avant d’intégrer le secteur de la pêche  il a un peu évolué dans la maçonnerie. Il s’intéresse  beaucoup au développement  de son activité et a son aspect lucratif. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 dans le but d’acquérir un GPS qui est un appareil qui guide et oriente le pêcheur en pleine mer. Son but  est d’augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer la situation de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Alioune N. is a fisherman of 37 years. He lives at Yoff. He is married and father to 2 children of between 4 and 7 years old. Mr N. has been a fisherman since 1989 when he left primary school. It was the line of work that was recommended to him by his father. Before going into fishing, he worked in masonry for a while. He is very interested in the development of his profession and in its profit making aspect .He has been a member of the Yoff fund since March 2010.He requests a loan of 150 000 XOF with the intention of buying a GPS (global positioning system) which is an appliance that guides and orientates the fisherman in the open sea. His aim is to increase his income and improve the living and social conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Fe Esperanza” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un varón.  Los negocios que desempeñan son variados: Artesanía (tejido de chompas de lana), tienda de barrio,  elaboración de mantas de lana de angora, tejido de ropa de bebé, tienda de barrio, compra- venta de deportivos, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de comida, tejido a mano de mantas.

La señora presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Julia, casada, madre de cuatro hijos, comenta que este es su primer ciclo,  indica que forma parte del B.C. “Fe y Esperanza” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de Pro Mujer.  La señora Julia abrió hace cuatro meses una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, por iniciativa propia, la tienda está abierta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, para su atención cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Su crédito de Bs. 1000.-, este monto será invertido en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta trabajar con las señoras y el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) Community Bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer. It is part of the Senkata central office. Fe y Esperanza is a new group formed to access credit, training, and health education, and is composed of ten woman and one man. They run several businesses: crafts (knitting wool sweaters), neighbourhood shops, making ponchos from angora wool, knitting baby clothes, sportswear sales, cosmetics sales, vegetable sales, food sales, and weaving ponchos by hand.

Señora Julia is president of the group. She is married and has four children. This is her first loan cycle. She became part of the group after being invited by the development officers of Pro Mujer who were in the neighbourhood to explain the program. Four months ago Sra. Julia opened a store in her house. It is open from 7 am to 9 pm. Her children help her run the store. She plans to buy more stock with her loan. 

Of the advantages offered by Pro Mujer, Julia most likes working with the other women and having access to health services.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, pasta etc.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Monsieur Daouda N. est âgé de 30ans. Il habite à Yoff. Il évolue dans le secteur de la pêche depuis 1996. C’est après avoir abandonné l’école qu’il a opté pour cette activité. Sa passion est d’aller en haute mer, attraper beaucoup de poissons qu’il va vendre aux mareyeurs. Il est marié,  soutien de famille et père  d’un enfant de 9 mois. Monsieur N. est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2007. Il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné  à l’achat d’un appareil GPS  pour mieux gérer  et sécuriser son activité. L’amélioration de ses revenus lui permettra d’améliorer sa situation sociale ainsi que celle de sa famille. Son rêve est d’avoir la possibilité d’épargner et d’acquérir un terrain avec les revenus de son activité.
texts.en: Mr Daouda N. is 30 years old. He lives in Yoff.He has been working in the fishing business since 1996.It was after abandoning school that he chose this occupation.
