His passion is to go out to the open sea to catch plenty of fish that he then sells to the wholesale fish merchants. He is married, the bread winner of the family and has a son of 9 months old. Mr N. has been a member of the Yoff fund since July 2007.He has already repaid 2 previous loans to the organisation. He requests a credit of 300000 frs intended for the purchase of a GPS appliance to improve the management and safety of his activity. The increase in his income will allow him to improve his social situation and that of his family. His dream is to have the possibility of saving up and buying some land with the profits from his business.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks and a stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Allison

texts.en:
Growing up, Allison B. was always interested in owning her own business and when she was laid off, it was an opportune time to pursue that goal. Allison’s knowledge of the construction field is extensive, with her degrees in land development and construction management. With her experience working for a general contractor and development agencies and working as an owner’s representative, Allison understands the trials and concerns of all the actors involved in constructing a building. So when Allison was laid off, she decided to start her own construction consulting business, "Autumn Leaves". She consults with, or acts as a mediator between, owners, contractors, and sub-contractors. For example, owners are required to hire a certain percentage of women and minorities for big projects. Allison helps owners meet requirements like these and navigate the system. Also, because many sub-contractors are more knowledgeable about their trade or skills than about how to manage a business, she helps sub-contractors manage their finances and contracts. Allison’s most recent project is to consult with an owner on how to build an energy-efficient office building with walls made out of clay and mud. She will assist the owner to obtain green certification for the building.

Even though Allison has been recognized as an honoree of the  National Association of Minority Contractors because of the success of "Autumn Leaves", this loan will help her expand her business even more. Allison plans on using her loan to buy scheduling software and market her business. This interactive software will allow her to provide a unique service to contractors who need help with scheduling because owners always want a complete schedule from their contractors.

Allison’s next goal is to consult with companies to recycle their construction waste. Allison says, “I don’t always have a steady check coming in, but I enjoy working for myself. It was what I was meant to do all along. It is so rewarding.”  

Feel free to check out Allison’s website: http://www.autumnleavesconstruction.com

loans.use: Scheduling Software and Marketing

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: Braulio tiene 20 años, vive en compañía de sus padres, en la propiedad de sus progenitores. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, utilizando un auto que arrienda, de esa manera recorre todas las calles de la ciudad brindando este servicio y del que tiene mucha demanda. Su habilidad para conducir y el conocimiento de las reglas de transito le favorecen en el buen desempeño de su trabajo, además disfruta este trabajo porque llega a conocer más las calles de su ciudad, asimismo reconoce que existen riesgos, pero es parte de la vida y sabe que tiene que cuidarse, afortunadamente nunca le ha ocurrido nada, además se siente satisfecho por las ganancias que le genera servicio que brinda, y por tal razón se siente motivado de continuar adelante con miras de adquirir su propia movilidad. Adicionalmente a esta actividad también se dedica a la agricultura, siendo aplicado en el terreno que sus padres le heredaron. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y espera recibir las ganancias que obtendrá de la venta de la cosecha para poder comprarse a crédito su carro.
texts.en:
Braulio is 20 and lives with his parents on their ancestors' land. For a year he has offered a taxi service, using a car that he leases. He travels through all of the streets of the city offering this service, which is in great demand. His skill for driving and his knowledge of the rules of transit serve him well and he does his job well. Furthermore, he enjoys this job because he has come to know more streets in his city. He also recognizes that there are certain risks, but this is part of life, and he knows that he has to take care of himself. Fortunately, nothing has ever happened to him. He is satisfied with the earnings that he generates from this service, and for this reason he feels motivated to continue moving forward with the goal of acquiring his own vehicle.
On top of this job, he also works in agriculture, working the land that his parents inherited. This is his first loan from MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, and he thanks every person who will lend toward his loan. It will be very useful in the progress of his business. With the loan that he is requesting, he will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer. He hopes to use his earnings from the sale of his harvest to buy his car on credit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer. He hopes to use the earnings from the sales of his harvest to purchase his car on credit.

loans.name: Maiama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama D. habite dans la communauté rurale de Bambilor. Elle est  mariée et âgée  de 38 ans. Pour disposer de revenus réguliers madame D. a choisi d’évoluer dans le secteur du commerce depuis l’année  dernière. Ainsi elle s’active dans l’achat et la vente de parfums et de savons de toilettes. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son  stock de produits. Ce financement lui permettra de seconder son mari  dans les charges au sein du foyer telles que les frais de scolarisation des enfants, et autres dépenses diverses.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariama D. lives in the rural community of Bambilor. She is married and 38 years old. In order to earn a regular income, Mrs. D. chose to join the retail sector last year. Her business is selling perfumes and soaps. She has been a member of the Bambilor fund since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to strengthen her stock of products. This funding will enable her to help her husband with her family's expenses, such as school fees for the children and other miscellaneous expenses.

loans.use: Strengthen stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Lesbia Mireya

texts.es: Lesbia Maria tiene 40 años, se dedica a una pulpería y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es una mujer muy responsable por lo que está muy agradecida con este medio de vida. Lo inicio  por medio de fondos propios pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener este negocio, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos y otras cosas.
texts.en: Lesbia Maria is 40. She has a convenience store and sells general merchandise. She has had this business for over three years, and it is her main source of income. She is a very responsible woman as she is very grateful for her way of life. She started her business with her own funds and with a lot of hard work. She has 2 young children under her care. She sells candy, soft drinks, bread, juice, and other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “ALFA Y OMEGA” inicia su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son diferentes: producción y venta de zapatos, venta y producción de mantas a crochet, venta de muebles, artesanía en alfombras, costura en artesanía en sombreros, venta de verduras, ferretería, comerciante de carne, artesanía en alfombras. Estas señoras tienen dentro de la mesa directiva a la tesorera que vela por que todas las transacciones financieras del grupo estén en orden, haciendo cumplir su reglamento interno.

 La señora tesorera de la banca comunal, la señora SaturN., este es su segundo ciclo,   que forma parte del B.C. “Alfa y Omega”.  La señora SaturN. produce y vende zapatos desde hace 6 años, al mismo que teje mantas.  Su crédito actual de Bs. 2000.- es para la compra de material, para la elaboración del calzado.
Generalmente sus ventas son realizadas en la “Ceja” de 7 de la mañana a 12 del medio día.
texts.en:
The "ALFA Y OMEGA" loan group begins its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch focal centre. This is a new group which has been fomed to receive credit, training and healthcare services. It has nine members that work in several activities: making and selling shoes, making and selling crochet blankets, selling furniture, making carpets, making hats, selling vegetables, owning a hardware store, selling meat and making carpets. The treasurer, who sits on the group board, ensures that all financial transactions are in order and enforces the internal rules of the group.

The treasurer of the "Alfa Omega" loan group is SaturN., who is on her second cycle. She has been making and selling shoes for 6 years, and she also weaves blankets. The loan of 2,000 bolivares is for the purchase of material to make footwear with. She usually sells her products at La Ceja, from 7 in the morning to 12 noon.

loans.use: Buy material to make footwear and blankets with.

loans.name: Lucy Diana

texts.es:
Lucy de 22 años, tiene un taller de producción y reparación de zapatos. Vive con sus cinco hijos de 6, 5, 4, 3, 2 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

El ex esposo le enseño como hacer zapatos y coserlos para que le ayude en el trabajo que el realizaba pero cuando se separo de él decidió independizarse. Ya tiene dos años trabajando independientemente produciendo y arreglando zapatos en la parte delantera de su casa. Su rutina del trabajo es iniciar las mañanas enviando a sus hijos a la escuela en el camino a casa comprar los materiales para hacer los zapatos y comienza a realizar los pedidos que los clientes les piden. Una de las dificultades para realizar su trabajo es que solo cuenta con una maquina y no tiene muchas opciones cuando se le daña. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar suelas, hilos para la elaboración de los zapatos. En el futuro quiere confeccionar y producir a una mayor cantidad los zapatos para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 22, has a workshop for making and repairing shoes.  She lives with her five children, ages 6, 5, 4, 3, and 2, in an urban zone.  This urban area is considered to be a suburb of Guayaquil and most of its inhabitants work as informal traders. 

Her ex-husband taught her how to make shoes and how to sew them.  He did this so that she could help him in his work.  When she separated from him she decided to become independent.  For two years she has been working independently making and fixing shoes in the front part of her house.

Her work routine is to start the morning by sending her children to school.  On the way home she buys the materials to make the shoes.  Then she works on the orders from her customers.  One of the difficulties in her work is that she only has one machine.  She does not have a lot of options when it is broken.

She wants to use the loan to buy soles and thread for making shoes.  In the future she wants to make and produce a greater quantity of shoes in order to give her children a better life.

loans.use: Soles and thread

loans.name: Elita

texts.es: Elita tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos comestibles, gaseosas y cervezas, en su tienda, negocio que habilitó en el interior de su casa, desde entonces atiende todos los días de la semana, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas, cuyas ganancias que obtiene en este negocio son regulares, es por esta razón que puede ayudar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijas. Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y conejos de raza grande que comercializa muy bien en los mercados de la zona por donde vive, este negocio es rentable ya que el cuidado de estos animales no requiere de mucho sacrificio y su alimentación es barata. Para el futuro esta dispuesta ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, asimismo desea comprar mayor cantidad de animales y mejorar las jaulas de éstos que están quedando pequeñas. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por otro lado agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Elita, age 40, lives with her husband and their three children in her own house.  For nine years she has been selling different products like food, soft drinks, and beer in her house.  She set up her business in her house, and she works every day of the week.  Also, she has help from her daughters.  She gets regular earnings from this business.  That is why she is able to help her husband with their daughters’ education.

She also raises guinea pigs and large breed rabbits.  They sell very well in the markets in the area where she lives. This business is profitable because the care for these animals does not require much sacrifice, and their food is cheap.

In the future she is prepared to expand her store.  She also wishes to buy more animals and improve the cages, which are small.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has some financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the requested loan.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Angela Samaria

texts.es: Ángela Samaria tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de hot dog, gaseosa, hamburguesa. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio vendiendo de manera ambulante en las calles con las pocas ganancias que lograba recolectar construyo su propio carretón ahora está ubicado en un lugar en donde transitan mucho clientes y ofrece sus deliciosos productos a gran cantidad de clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de carne, pan, jugos, refrescos, salchicha, aceite y otros ya que se acerca la temporada festiva de navidad y otros eventos que se realizan. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para su hijo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Samaria is 40 years old.  She sells hot dogs, soft drinks, and hamburgers.  She has had this business for over 11 years.  She started by selling in an itinerant manner on the streets.  With the little earnings that she managed to collect, she built her own cart.  She is now located in a place where a lot of customers travel.  She sells her delicious products to a lot of customers.

The reason for the loan is to buy meat, bread, juice, soft drinks, sausages, oil, and other items.  The festive Christmas season and other events are getting close.  

She dreams of improving her house for her children and expanding her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre María Auxiliadora, se conformó en fecha 03 de agosto del 2006, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Ma. Ana A., quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, logró  contactar con la asesora en la oficina Regional de Itá, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 12º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Durante todo el transcurso de estos ciclos han tenido algunos inconvenientes con algunas compañeras y tuvieron algunos problemas de pago, que gracias a la nueva modalidad de pago que ofrece el programa han superado los inconvenientes y están demostrando  un excelente cumplimiento de pago.
 Las mismas gracias al apoyo crediticio recibido con este programa han logrado sobresalir  en cada una de sus actividades, han demostrado una vez más que las mujeres son pilares esenciales dentro de una familia y que las mismas también pueden superarse cada día más.
La señora Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora  y quiere continuar con la cría y venta de gallinas. 
A ella le conviene mucho esta actividad ya que le genera buena ganancia y semanalmente obtiene buenos ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de  bebederos, balanceados para alimentos de los animales y otros.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Women's Committee was set up on the 3rd of August 2006 when the current managing director Mrs María Ana A., who has a business selling chickens, contacted the advisor in the regional office in Itá to find out how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) works.

Once she had been advised about how the program works, she got together 16 women who are now working very happily together on their 12th loan cycle as a united and supportive group within the program.  Over the course of all these loan cycles they have faced a number of problems with some of their fellow members and had some difficulties meeting their repayments but, thanks to the new payment method which the program now offers, they have managed to overcome their difficulties and are showing an excellent repayment performance.

The members of the group are grateful for the support of the loans they have received from this program which have enabled them to succeed in each one of their business activities.  They have showed once again that women are essential pillars within the family and that they can better themselves every day.

María is a very enterprising woman and she would like to continue raising and selling chickens.  The work really suits her as it generates a good income and she obtains good profits weekly.

She is requesting this loan to buy, amongst other things, water troughs and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy water troughs, balanced animal feed, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Aida

texts.es:
Patricia de 49 años, vende joyería de artesanía, vive con su esposo e hijos de 31, 26, 17 y 10 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Hace 15 años atrás aprendió hacer manualidades con artesanías para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que una de sus hijas tiene el virus VIH en su sangre y necesita algunos tratamientos personales en una institución llamada “REDIMAS” en donde Patricia ayuda en su tiempo libre a dar charlas de motivación a las personas infectadas con la experiencia que ha pasado su familia con su hija. Trabaja en las mañana vendiendo las manualidades haciendo con algunos materiales de artesanía las pulseras, aretes, cadenas y en la noche da las charlas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales para realizar las artesanías como metal, madera, plásticos etc. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para ayuda a su esposo que es ebanista y seguir ayudando con charlas de motivación a los infectados de VIH.
texts.en:
Patricia is 49 years old and sells hand-made jewelry.  She lives with her husband and children aged 31, 26, 17 and 10 in an urban district which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are traders and salesmen.  This district is the suburb of Guayaquil.

She learned to make crafts 15 years ago as a way of spending more time with her children since one of her daughters has HIV in her blood and needs personal treatment in an institution called “REDIMAS” where Patricia helps out in her free time giving motivational talks to people infected with HIV, recounting the experience that her family has had with their daughter.

Patricia works in the mornings selling the crafts which she makes such as bracelets, earrings and chains.  In the evenings she gives her talks.

She would like to use her loan to buy materials for making her crafts such as metal, wood, plastic, etc.  In the future, she would like to continue working to help her husband who is a cabinet maker and continue helping with the motivational talks for those infected with HIV.

loans.use: To buy metal, wood and plastic

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr: Monsieur sidi D. est un habitant de Bambilor. C’est un jeune célibataire de 26 ans qui s’active dans l’élevage de poussins  et le commerce de marchandises diverses depuis 2006. Monsieur D. a pour objectif de se procurer des revenus pour faire face à certaines dépenses. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis avril 2010. Il emprunte un montant de 500000frs prévu d'une part pour l'augmentation de ses sujets et d'autre part pour l’achat  de quelques  marchandises diverses pour les besoins de son commerce  dans le cadre des préparatifs des fêtes  de tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en: Mr. Sidi D. lives in Bambilor. He is a young, single man of 26 who has had a business raising chickens and selling various other merchandise since 2006.  Mr. D.'s objective is to earn enough revenue to be able to pay for his expenses. He has been a member of the Bambilor fund since April, 2010. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, part of which he will use to increase his livestock and the other part will be used to purchase some of the general goods he needs for his business in preparation for sales related to "tabaski" (a large holiday in Senegal) celebrations. This loan will enable him to increase his revenues.

loans.use: To grow his funds

loans.name: Jose Aben

texts.es: José Aben tiene 30 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de barbería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. El aprendió por que anteriormente aprendía en otra barbería, José puso mucho empeño en él para aprender este negocio así con los pocos ahorros que obtuvo logro establecer su propio negocio y está ubicado en lugar en donde es muy visitado por diferentes personas el ofrece una muy buena calidad de corte a sus clientes y también se esmera en brindar buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de tijeras, talcos, espumas, brochas entre otros productos que son necesarios. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en: José Aben is 30 years old.  He works as a barber.  He has been in this business for more than 6 years.  He learned his trade in another barber shop where he used to work.  José put a lot of effort into learning the business and used the small amount of savings which he had to set up his own business which is located in a place where he gets a lot of different customers.  He offers a very good quality of cut to  his customers and takes care to provide a good service.  He is requesting a loan to buy scissors, talcum powder, shaving foam and shaving brushes as well as other necessary products.  He dreams of improving his business and his home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tiene 54 años, vive con el menor D. sus 6  hijos en su casa propia. DesD. que era niña a aprendido todo las técnicas agrarias, desD. entonces siembra hortalizas, verduras pero principalmente la papa y el maíz, que son productos que más venD.. Su trabajo es diario pero con el paso D. los años se ha dado cuenta que la compra y venta D. animales es un negocio es muy rentable, esta actividad complementa sus ingresos, ya que debe tomar tiempo D. espera hasta que sus productos estén listos para la cosecha, así que los fines D. semana lleva a vender estos animales a feria ganadera y lo que no llega a vender lo lleva a su establo que lo utiliza para su propio consumo. Durante estos años D. trabajo ha visto que la venta D. animales tiene menores riesgos y mayores ganancias por lo que su deseo es incrementar su capital D. trabajo e intensificar en la crianza D. animales. Es el crédito número 7 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más animales como cerdos y ovejas.
texts.en:
Elva is 54 years old.  She lives with the youngest of her 6 children in her own home.  She started learning agricultural techniques when she was a little girl.  Since that time, she has been growing vegetables; some greens but mainly potatoes and corn which are the products which sell most.  Her work is daily but over the years she has come to realize that the buying and selling of animals is a very profitable business.  This activity complements her income since it takes time for her crops to be ready for harvest.  On weekends she sells her animals at the livestock market and what she doesn't manage to sell she takes home to her stable and uses it for her own consumption.  Over her  working life, she has seen that the sale of animals has less risks and makes more profits.  For this reason, she would like to increase her working capital and put more time and effort into raising animals.

This is Elva's 7th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She would also like to thank everybody who helps fund her loan because it will be very useful for her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more animals such as pigs and sheep.

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja y su hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, su fin es ganar dinero honradamente, anteriormente ayudaba a su madre en la agricultura, sembrando arveja y papa, luego emprendió el negocio de venta de cervezas a concesión, pero aún así buscaba una actividad más tranquila y rentable. Es por eso que hace unos meses empezó con la venta de ropa para bebé, al principio lo dudo, pero ante la demanda adquirió algunos conjuntos de lana para bebé, logrando venderlos a sus amigas y conocida, es así como ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar donde pueda ofrecer la ropa para bebé, además de otro tipo de mercadería. Es su octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en productos en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Fanny is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and her child in her parents' home.  She started working independently when she was very young.  Her aim is to earn money honestly.  She used to help her mother farm, growing peas and potatoes.  Then she started a business selling beer but she was still looking for a business activity which was calmer and more profitable.  For this reason, some months ago she started selling baby clothes.  At the beginning she wasn't sure but there was a demand so she acquired some woollen outfits for babies and managed to sell them to her friends and acquaintances, thereby managing to increase her income.  As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to set up a small store where she can sell baby clothes as well as other types of merchandise.

This is Fanny's eighth loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support and likes being a part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people who are very supportive of one another.  She would like to thank those people who fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more merchandise, more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, to have more merchandise to offer her customers

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yadira Del Carmen tiene 36 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Empezó con fondos propios ya que no tenía suficiente capital, para comprar una gran variedad de productos que son necesarios en la pulpería, los vecinos, amigos y familiares llegan a su hogar que es donde está ubicado este medio de vida. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, huevos, sopas entre otras cosas. Sueña con aumentar su negocio para ofrecer de todo un poco.
texts.en: Yadira Del Carmen is 36 years old.  She owns a small grocery store and has been in this business for more than 2 years.  She started out with her own funds but didn't have enough capital to buy a large range of products which is necessary for a grocery store.  Her neighbors, friends and family members come to her home which is where her store is located.  She is requesting this loan to buy candies, detergents, basic grains, juice, eggs and soup, amongst other things.  She dreams of increasing her business and being able to offer a little of everything.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Activas es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 20 de Abril del 2010, integrado por 17  mujeres. 
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra.  Miguela F., quien ya formó parte anteriormente de otro grupo junto con otras compañeras   se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca de la posibilidad de retomar nuevamente el de Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
En vistas de que la respuesta de la asesora fue positiva, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 3er. ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Todas se  dedican a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra de frutas y verduras, compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de mercerías, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (azúcar, arroz, yerba, panificados, lácteos, carnes, etc.), compra de ropa para la venta.
Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Miguela F. quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma elabora.
La venta lo realiza en desde su casa y obtiene buenos ingresos y comenta que esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente para los comestibles que ella prepara especialmente carne, ya que el precio se encuentra muy alta.
texts.en:
The 'Comité Mujeres Activas' (Committee of Active Women) is an excellent committee which was established on 20th April 2010.  It has 17 female members.

This group was formed when Mrs Miguela F., who was previously part of another group, approached the advisor in a loan renewal meeting in her district, to find out about the possibility of regrouping in the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program.

The advisor's response was positive and Miguela was very enthusiastic and very keen to be able to work within the program.  Her group now finds itself working very happily on its third loan cycle in the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' program.

All the members of the group work in different business activities such as buying fruits and vegetables, buying ingredients to prepare food, buying notions, buying merchandise for a grocery store (sugar, rice, yerba, bakery products, dairy products, meat, etc.) and buying clothes to sell.

This is a very active group.  All its members show team spirit and support each other.  They attend the weekly meetings and carry out activities to collect funds for the common good of the group.

One of the group's members is Miguela F. who sells food which she makes herself.  She sells her food from her home and makes a good income.  She comments that this activity makes her good profits.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to make the food which she prepares, especially meat as the price of meat is very high right now.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, especially meat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es: Kattia tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde entonces siembra maíz y papa, que son productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado principal de su ciudad. En ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su madre, ya que el terreno donde cultiva es su herencia y de esta manera mejora los ingresos de su hogar; ya que su esposo trabaja de manera dependiente y lasa ganancias no son suficientes para el sustento familiar. Con mucha frecuencia verifica sus terrenos de cultivo, ya que quiere procurar que la plaga de insectos perjudique su siembra. Durante todos estos años ha visto que esta actividad ha sido un gran apoyo financiero para su familia, y por tanto continuará sembrando en sus terrenos de cultivo. Es el crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, por otro lado agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Kattia is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home.  She has been farming since she was a child.  She grows corn and potatoes which are in great demand in her city's main market.  She sometimes receives support from her mother since the land which she cultivates is her inheritance and in this way she improves her household income.  Her husband works for somebody else and his income is often not enough to support the family.

She checks on her land very often as she wants to make sure insect infestations do not put her crops at risk.  Throughout the years she has seen that this business activity has been a great financial help to her family and therefore she will continue growing on her land.

This is Kattia's 9th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and likes being a part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those people who fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of fertilizer for her next sowing season.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Real Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "REAL"; la socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kety Yovana: ella tiene 35 años de edad ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo;  la socia se dedica a la compra y  venta de ropa, ella viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Lima y  la ciudad de Puno  (Juliaca), para comprar de las fábricas ropa al por mayor y de temporada aprovechando los cambios de estación, ahora la socia manifiesta que requiere el crédito para viajar y traer ropa a la ciudad de Lima, porque están a puertas de iniciar el verano mientras que en la ciudad del Cusco estamos entrando al invierno, ella encuentra en estos cambios de estación mayores ofertas. La socia viajara aprovechando el cambio de estación en las siguientes semanas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería de tipo ropa para la venta.

Los otros socios se dedican a comercio de venta de accesorios para celulares, equipos de sonido y controles remotos para televisores; a la venta de pollos al por mayor y menor; a la venta de uniformes y otros.

En la foto se ve a los socios Mercedes, Veronica, Ramiro; que por motivos de salud pidieron permiso para reunirse al día siguiente. 

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Kety Yovana belongs to the “Real” community bank.  She lives in Huanchac district, Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Kety Yovana is 35 years old.  She is single and has one child.  Her business is buying and selling clothes.  She travels constantly to the city of Lima and the city of Puno (Juliaca) to buy seasonal clothes wholesale from the factories there, taking advantage of the changes in season.  She tells us that she would like this loan so that she can travel and bring back clothes from the city of Lima because the summer is about to begin whilst in the city of Cusco we are in winter.  She finds better offers in these changes of season.  She will travel, taking advantage of the change in season over the coming weeks.  She is requesting the loan to invest in buying clothes to sell.

The other members of the group have businesses which include selling accessories for cell phones, sound equipment and remote controls for televisions, chickens wholesale and retail and uniforms.

In the small picture on the top left you see the group members Mercedes, Veronica and Ramiro. For health reasons, they requested permission to meet the day after the group meeting.

Kety Yovana is grateful for the loan and pledges to continue working very hard to make her repayments and improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in buying clothes to sell

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 42 años, vive con su hijo en casa de su hermano. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de vacas y toros, desde entonces trabaja intensamente, por el lapso de varios meses espera a que estos animales estén con el peso exacto listos para ser vendidos. Por otro lado, obtiene también ingresos cuando alquila sus animales entre ellos al toro, que para época de siembra lo utilizan para el arado. Otros de las actividad que también realizan es la venta de leche que produce su vaca y todas las mañanas después de ordeñar lo lleva a vender en el mercado. Su gran anhelo es tener más cantidad de animales para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es el crédito número 8 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que  solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Marisol is 42 years old.  She lives with her son in her brother's house.    She has been in the business of raising, fattening and selling cows and bulls for 5 years.  She works very hard.  After a period of several months she hopes that her animals will be the right weight and ready to sell.  She also obtains income when she hires out her animals.  She hires out her bull, for example, during the sowing season so that people can use it to plow.  Another business activity which she pursues is selling the milk which her cow produces.  Every morning, after milking her cow, she takes the milk to sell in the market.  Her great wish is to be have more animals so that she can increase her working capital.

This is Marisol's 8th loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support and likes being a member of her community bank because the members are all responsible people who are very supportive of one another.  She is grateful to the people who will fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to invest in buying a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
A. rakhi is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is married to M. M. who is a laborer by profession. She has two sons and two daughters. Her elder son left his education after 8th grade and started a clothes selling business, while the younger children are attending school and getting their education. 

She lives in Kamoki, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its rice industry.  She lives there in the area named MuhA. azizpura in a two-room brick house with her husband, children and nephew. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her nephew in his embroidery business. He runs a shop in the market and offers his clients many different and unique embroidered designs on their clothes. With the loan, he will buy another embroidery machine and hire a worker who will help him fulfill orders on time. 

He has been operating this business for the past ten years and A. rakhi is hopeful that this investment will increase the output of his business and make it more profitable. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She hopes that it will be helpful to her nephew.

loans.use: To buy another embroidery machine

loans.name: Karina Adely

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos decorativos para fiestas infantiles (piñatería) en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio, adicionalmente brinda servicio de decoración para fiestas infantiles y diversos acontecimientos sociales. El negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que ella es una de las pocas personas que brinda este servicio y además es bastante rentable ya que ella misma elabora sus productos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de los gastos económicos de su familia.

Ella desea adquirir material como telas y tubos de metal para ampliar su negocio ya que usualmente tiene que alquilarlos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo. Karina es una joven bastante creativa y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacerse mas conocida en el rubro.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old.  She is single and lives together with her parents and siblings in Tambogrande district, a farming area which is in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Karina sells decorative articles for children's birthday parties (piñatas) in a small establishment located in her home.  She also provides decoration services for children's birthday parties and various social events.  Her business is very popular in the area since she is one of few people who provide this service and it is quite profitable because she makes her products herself.  She uses the income from this activity to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with her family's expenses.

Karina would like to acquire materials such as fabric and metal tubes to expand her business since she usually has to hire them.  For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles which she will use to achieve her goal.  Karina is quite a creative and enterprising young woman.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to become better known in her field.

loans.use: To buy fabric and metal poles to expand her business making decorations for parties and social events

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y radica junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Viviano Espinoza del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se caracteriza principalmente por producir mango y limón, el lugar se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Piura y pertenece a la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos, a los negociantes o en el mercado local. El negocio es su única fuente de ingreso y gracias a el solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a sus padres en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Anabel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucho cariño y estima.
texts.en:
Anabel is 24 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in Viviano Espinoza village, in the district of Tambogrande, a farming area which is noted mainly for producing mangoes and lemons.  It is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Anabel's business is raising pigs and poultry in a pen next to her home.  She feeds the animals grain and natural fodder.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors, to traders or in the local market.  The business is her only source of income.  It covers her personal expenses and helps her parents in financially supporting the family.

Anabel would like to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and balanced animal feed.  For this reason she is requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.  She is quite an active woman who has a great desire to succeed.  People who know her have a lot of affection and respect for her.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed to expand her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Hafeezan's Group

texts.en:
Hafeezan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a business of selling bakery items. He sells biscuits, bread and sandwiches to different bakery shops in the city. He has been in this business for over twenty years and is well known among his clients for the quality of his products. With the loan, he will buy bakery items in bulk quantity to fulfill the orders of his clients and to increase his income. 

Hafeezan helps support her family financially by selling school bags to different bag shops at the markets. First she takes orders by visiting the shops and then completes their orders on time to earn an income. She has given birth to four sons and two daughters. All of them are attending school except the eldest one who didn’t show interest in education and remains illiterate. 

Hafeezan is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and that her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She lives in Kamoki, which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She lives there in a three-room brick house with her family in Muhallah azizpura. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hafeezan.

loans.use: To buy bakery items for selling

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en fecha 16 de Setiembre del 2.008, mediante  la Sra.  Carolina V., quien ya había participado del programa en otro grupo.
 Ella es la actual presidenta del grupo y se dedica a la venta de bijouterie, fabricadas por  ella misma. 
Ella fabrica los bijouterie, de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe de los clientes, además de los aros, gargantillas, pulseras, actualmente está comenzando con las zapatillas bordadas que tiene buena aceptación de los  clientes. 
Sus productos son muy admirados por los clientes y el deja buena ganancia, por lo que quiere continuar con la actividad.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de todos los accesorios que la ella necesita para la elaboración de nuevas mercaderías.
 Ella comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con el grupo y que desea continuar ya que todas trabajan con esmero ya en el 7º ciclo, y en la actualidad el grupo esta conformado por 19 mujeres que trabajan  en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The 'Renacer' women's committee was created on the 16th of September 2008.  It was set up by Mrs Carolina V. who had already participated in another group in the program.

Carolina is the current group president and her business is selling costume jewelry which she makes herself.  She makes the jewelry according to the orders which she receives from her customers.  As well as making earrings, chokers and bracelets, she is currently beginning to make embroidered slippers as well which are proving very popular with her customers.  Her products are very much admired by her customers and maker her good profits.  For this reason, she would like to continue in this business.

She is requesting this loan to buy all the accessories which she needs to make her new goods.  She comments that she is very happy with the group and that she would like to continue as everybody is working with great care on their 7th loan cycle.  Currently the group has 19 female members who work together and with mutual support within the program.

All the group's members carry out business activities to make funds and they help each other out to achieve their common aims which they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.  They participate actively in the weekly meetings and work supportively in an impeccable manner.

loans.use: To buy different size and colored beads, sequins, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida lives in Kamoki which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Muhallah azizpura in a two-room brick house with her family. She moved here fifteen years ago after her marriage. 

Her husband, M. K., has a balloons-selling business. Balloons are considered children’s playthings. Children are fond of balloons and M. sells a variety of balloons by visiting different areas of the community on his bicycle. His variety and different colors are the reason for his good sales. 
 
Sajida herself is a housewife. She spends most of her time doing her household work, but in her spare time she helps her husband fill the balloons with air. They have an air machine that helps to fill the balloons. She has given birth to three sons and three daughters. Her three elder children are enrolled in school and getting their education, while the remaining children are below five years of age. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy balloon packets in bulk quantities, which will help increase his sales.  Sajida is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her husband and that he will be able to improve his business with it.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: To buy balloon packets in quantity for balloons-selling business

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a citizen of the city called Kamokay, which is located in Pakistan and famous for its rice industry. She is a very supportive lady by nature, and operates a schoolbags-selling business. She sells bags to different bag shops in the market and earns income from that. She started this business to assist her husband. Her business is now doing well and makes a good income which helps her in paying utility expenses. She is also a very good housewife who carries out her responsibilities well and finishes her household duties on time. She doesn’t have any children. 

Her husband is involved in a bedsheets-selling business. He buys sheets from the city of Multan and sells them to his neighboring areas and in the market as well. Jameela has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bedsheets in bulk quantities that will enable him to increase his sales and to earn more income. Jameela is hopeful that this investment will make her husband’s business more profitable and help him to afford bedsheets of a different variety, which will help to make more money.
 
She is a new loan user and this is her 1st loan application. In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets for reselling

loans.name: Esther Marujita

texts.es:
Esther de 45 años, vende comida en la tarde, vive con su esposo e hijo en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Empezó ha vender comida para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Su día de trabajo comienza en la mañana cuando comprar todos los víveres para preparar la comida, después de tener todo listo inicia la preparación de los platos en primer lugar la sopa, después el segundo que es el palto fuerte y el jugo. A partir de las 12h00 comienza a vender a $ 1.60 c/u. Poco a poco ha variado los platos para sus clientes con ayuda de su hijo. La comida la realiza en la cocina de su casa y la vende en la parte delantera donde tienes mesas y sillas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pinturas para readecuar su casa para tener más espacio para el negocio. En el futuro quiere darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Esther is 45 and lives with her husband and child in Suburbio de Guayaquil, she sells food in the afternoons. The area is notable for the fact that a majority of its residents are merchants. She began selling food as a way to help her husband with household expenses. 

Her workday begins in the morning when she buys the ingredients to prepare the food. After gathering everything she begins by making soup, then the main course and juice. Starting at noon she sells these for $ 1.60 each. Little by little and with her son's help she has varied the menu. She prepares the food in her home's kitchen and sells it in the front of the house where she has tables and chairs. 

With this loan she wants to buy cement and paint to remodel the home to make more space for the business. She hopes to give her son a better future going forward.

loans.use: Cement, paint

loans.name: Bradis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Bradis es madre de familia de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 35 años y se dedica al comercio de transporte, teniendo unidad de taxi, quien con ahorros de su esposo, inicio hace varios años.
La dificultad es el alza de gasolina que se da día tras día, lo que los clientes no quieren pagar más de lo que pagan, teniendo perdidas al no abordar.
Su casa la ha venido construyendo atreves de los prestamos que la institución ha dado pues durante estos diez ciclos ha logrado remodelarla por completa, lo que para ella es de gran satisfacción  y que gracias Afodenic se ha hecho posible. Hoy en día lo que desea es  comprar dos puertas, y ventana para terminar de cerrar su casa por completo.
texts.en:
Bradis is 35 years old and the mother of three children. She works in the transport sector and has her own taxi. She started her business with her husband’s savings some years ago.

Bradis has encountered difficulties due to the cost of petrol, which rises daily. Her customers don’t want to pay any more than what they are currently paying, which means that she is running her taxi service at a loss.

Thanks to the ten cycles of loans that she had taken out with Afodenic, Brandis has been able to completely remodel her house, which has given her a great sense of satisfaction. Now she would like to purchase two doors and a window to completely enclose her house.

loans.use: Purchase two doors and a window for her house

loans.name: Siga Thioumboud

texts.fr:
Madame SIGA THIUOMBOUD D. est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 05 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits céréaliers tels du mil, du niébé, des arachides etc.

Son crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et d'assurer la nourriture et scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Siga Thiuomboud D. is a 50 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She is also caring for five other children who have been entrusted to her by relatives. She has a small business selling various goods, including millet, black-eyed peas, peanuts etc. This loan will enable her to grow her level of stock, which will ultimately increase her income. Her objective is to generate enough income to enable her to pay for the needs of her family and ensure that her children have enough food, and can go to school.

loans.use: To develop and promote her business.

loans.name: Maria Corina

texts.es:
Corina es una joven de 22 años de edad,  trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, pues ha tenido que trabajar mucho para dar lo necesario a sus hijos. Su esposo es un pequeño comerciante de venta de cd quien realiza de forma ambulante en un mercado de la capital.
Hoy en día está trabajando en servicios domésticos, pues lleva un año ya laborando con el propósito de poder construir una vivienda mejor, ya que en donde habita es forrado de zinc lo que desea comenzar  a construir un arranque de piedra, lo que comenzara poco a poco con el apoyo de Afodenic, ya que sus ingresos son bajos y desea pagar en tiempo y forma para lograr el objetivo en la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Corina is a hard-working young woman.  She is 22 years old and has two children, so she has had to work a lot to give her children what they need.  Her husband runs a small business selling CDs as a traveling vendor at a market in the capitol city.

Corina currently works in domestic services, and she has spent a year working with the goal of building a better home.  Since she now lives in a house made of zinc sheets, she wants to begin building a stone base.  With Afodenic's support she will begin little by little because her income is low, and she wants to make her payments on time in order to reach her goal of building her house.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build her house of concrete since it is currently made of metal sheets

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group 'Primera Esperanza 5', which translates as 'First Hope 5'. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Martha lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Martha's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. As well as Dominicans, Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Martha's community.
  
She has owned an underwear business (selling a variety of garments) for three years now and is applying for a loan to invest in stock to try and grow her business. She has previously taken out loans with Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner in the Dominican Republic and Haiti) but this will be her (and her group's) first Kiva loan. Martha will use her first loan with Esperanza to set up her business. She says that, since then, subsequent loans have allowed her to successfully grow the business. As a result, Martha says that her family has benefited, as has her local community, because now they don't have to travel so far to buy underwear. 

Martha says that her favorite pastimes are studying and spending time with her children. She also says that her most difficult challenge is finding the money to complete her studies. Her dream is simple, and applies to both the present and the future. She simply wants to keep doing things that make her a good person.

loans.use: To invest in underwear business

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Karla Maria tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, tiene 22 años, ya que ella es una madre soltera y busca obtener ingresos para su hogar. El se dedica a la venta de comida. Desde hace 2 años, que tiene este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes aprecian la buena comida que realiza por lo que es muy importante para ella ofrecer buena calidad. Su préstamo inicial es para incrementar el capital de su negocio de granos básicos, juegos, aceite, verduras entre otras cosas.
Su sueño es que su negocio se convierta en un restaurante en donde ofrezca una gran variedad de comidas. Pues ahorita se acercan épocas muy buenas.
texts.en: Karla Maria is 22 years old and has one child.  She is a single mother seeking to earn an income for her household.  She has been selling food for a living for the past 2 years and the majority of her customers appreciate the good quality food that she offers.  This is her first loan and she will use it to buy basic grains, juice, oil, vegetables, etc.  Her dream is to one day convert her business into a restaurant where she will offer a wide variety of foods.   Right now, things are going well for her.

loans.use: To purchase grains, juice, vegetables, etc for her business

loans.name: Tesapeara Group

texts.es:
Tesapeara se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en fecha 14 de enero de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra.  Luz R., quien se dedica a la atención de su peluquería.
 Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Luz se trabaja como peluquera la cual le resulta bastante bien ya que cuenta con un cliente formado quienes la visitan semanalmente. 
Comenta que el trabajo deja buena ganancia, pero que es muy sacrificado, especialmente por los dolores de brazos que causa después de trabajar mucho tiempo en la profesión. 
Pero refiere que todo lo hizo con muchas ganas de ayudar a su familia a salir delante de la mejor manera posible. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos que ella utiliza en la peluquería y además para cubrir algunos gastos familiares.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Tesapeara is the name of this excellent group of women which was established on 14th of January 2009 thanks to the current Managing Director, Mrs Luz R., who has her own hairdressing salon.

Once she had received advice about how the program works, Luz managed to gather together 17 women who are now happily working on their 6th loan cycle as a united and supportive group within the program.

Luz works as a hairdresser which is a good business because she has regular customers who visit her weekly.  She comments that the work pays well but that it is very sacrificing especially owing to the pains in her arms which she has after having worked so many years in her profession.  Everything she has done has been with a great desire to help her family to get ahead in the best way possible.

She is requesting this loan to buy products which she uses in her hairdressing salon and also to cover some family expenses.  All the women in this group carry out business activities to make money and help each other in order to achieve the common objectives which they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, hair creams, oils and other products

loans.name: Fatima Rosa

texts.es:
Fátima es una mujer emprendedora, con un  hijo de 8 años de edad, es madre soltera. Lo que ha tenido que esforzarse más por la educación de su hijo.
Trabaja como asesora de venta en una empresa privada, desde hace varios años, y ha venido haciendo anexo a su casa, teniendo el inicio del arranque y materiales comprados, pero por falta de efectivo no ha podido continuar.
Lo que como iniciativa la idea de un financiamiento en donde pueda resolver la continuación de su proyecto. Lo que Afodenic es quien da el financiamiento y logra avanzar, ahora con este nuevo financiamiento  comprara: bloques, piedra, arena, cemento y continuar la obra. Lo que está contenta por este beneficio ya que lograra un comienzo en la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en:
Fátima is an enterprising woman with an 8-year-old son.  She is a single mother, so she has had to work harder to give her son an education.

She has worked for several years as a sales consultant for a private company, and she has been building an addition onto her house.  She has begun the project and bought materials, but she cannot continue for lack of money.

Fátima had the idea of getting a loan so she can continue her construction project.  Afodenic is giving her the loan, and she will use it to buy blocks, stone, sand and cement to continue the project.  She is pleased because she will be able to make a start on building the room.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish construction on her house

loans.name: Arling Melissa

texts.es:
La Joven Arling M. se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, Joyas de Plata, para Damas y caballeros, actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar en la aldea de Jutiapa, Jamastran, aldeas y caseríos circunvecinos y de igual manera con clientes de la ciudad de Danlí.
Arling se a sabido ganar la clientela, mismos que la prefieren por las facilidades de pago que les ofrece y por la buena calidad de productos que vende ya que son de marcas reconocidas.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable. Arling tiene muchas metas y sueños que piensa cumplir por que es una joven muy luchadora y no se vence a los obstáculos que le presenta la vida.
Arling es madre soltera tiene una niña de 3 años la cual depende a un 100% de ella y que con los ingresos que le genera su negocio cubre todos sus gastos personales y los de su hija.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando sus estudios universitarios mismos que se paga con los ingresos que le genera su negocio,  su meta es graduarse de la universidad de Licenciada en Pedagogía, para prepararse mucho más y poder brindar después el estudio que su hija desea, su pequeña hija le dice que cuando ella sea grande quiere ser Doctora.
texts.en:
Arling M. is a young woman who has a business selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics and silver jewelry for men and women.  She sells her goods door to door in the village of Jutiapa, Jamastran, in neighboring towns and villages and also to customers in the city of Danlí.

Arling has known how to attract customers who like doing business with her because of the payment facilities which she offers and the good quality of the products she sells which are well-known brands.  The growth of her business has been outstanding.  Arling has many goals and dreams which she would like to fulfil as she is a fighter and she doesn't give up when life puts obstacles in her way.

Arling is a single mother who has a 3 year-old girl who depends on her 100%.  With the profits she makes in her business, she covers her own personal expenses and those of her daughter.

Currently Arling is pursuing her university studies which she is funding with the profits which she makes in her business.  Her goal is to graduate from university with a degree in pedagogy (education) so that she can prepare herself much more and then be able to provide her daughter with the education that she wishes for.  Her young daughter says that when she grows up she would like to be a doctor.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, creams, lotions and perfumes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Madame Marie N. est une femme de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE SUD depuis le 25 juin 2002.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois. Elle est détentrice d'un salon de coiffure

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son approvisionnement en effets et produits pour mieux satisfaire et fidéliser sa clientèle 

Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille par la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants par exemple
texts.en: Mrs. Marie N. is a 39 year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Montagne Sud since the 25th of June, 2002. She has been a hairdresser since she joined the Village Bank. She is the owner of a hair salon. With this new loan, she will strengthen her stock of products in order to better satisfy and retain her customers. She uses her income to improve her family's living conditions with food and to finance her children's education, for example.

loans.use: To promote her hairdressing business

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: La Señora Maria Isaura tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, vive en el municipio de santo tomas, en donde tiene una gran variedad de clientes. Tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad ambos estudian en colegios públicos. Con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos educación, casa, salud y vestimenta. Ella es comerciante de ropa la ofrece de manera ambulante todos los días sin un horario fijo, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años. Este crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir más su local. Ya que actualmente tiene ciertos pedidos por acercarse la época navideña y así ofrecer variedad.
texts.en: Maria Isaura has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time.  She lives in the town of Santo Tomas where she has a lot of customers.  She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children who are both studying in local schools.  Through work and effort, she and her husband have managed to provide their children with education, a house, healthcare and clothes.  Maria Isaura has a business selling clothes.  She sells her goods itinerantly every day without fixed hours.  She has been doing this for 4 years.  She will invest this loan in buying more clothes to stock her business since she currently has some orders pending with the Christmas period approaching and she would like to be able to offer more variety.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La Sra. Epifania S. Benegas de 38 años de edad, es comerciante desde hace mas de 6 años, tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace más de 3 años. 
Solicitó el crédito para aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías para la venta en su despensa, donde atiende a una gran cantidad de clientes, mas en los días viernes, sábados y domingos.
Nos comenta que gracias al primer crédito que retiró de la Fundación Paraguaya, ha logrado aumentar de manera progresiva la cantidad de mercaderías puestos para la venta y de esa manera aumentó aún más sus ingresos. Con estas ventajas asegura que logrará mejorar su calidad de vida  y de su familia. Comenta que día a día seguirá trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para lograr todos sus objetivos
texts.en:
Mrs. Epifania S. Benegas, 38, has been a merchant for over 6 years; she has had a well-stocked store for over three years.

She asked for a loan to increase the amount of merchandise to sell in her store where she takes care of a large number of customers, more on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.

She comments that thanks to the first loan she got from Fundación Paraguaya she has been able to progressively increase the amount of goods for sale thus increasing her income.  She assures us that these advantages will make it possible for her to improve her family’s quality of life.  She comments that she will continue to work every day with much effort to reach all her goals.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk and canned goods.

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha  es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo desde su juventud, con una hija quien ha criado sola, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su ex compañero.
Su trabajo hoy en día, es de cajera en un almacén en donde lleva varios años laborando. Con sus ahorros y financiamiento hizo su casa en donde todos sus créditos lo ha invertido en la mejora de la casa. Como solo una hija tiene, y cursa la universidad. Alquila un cuarto en donde tiene una entrada fija. Logrando pagar gastos básicos.
Con este préstamo tiene como meta el comienzo de dos cuartos con el fin de poder alquilar dos más y lograr a futuro mejores entradas económicas, lo que comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra al fondo del patio. Contenta una vez más por el apoyo económico de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman who has worked very hard since she was young.  She has a daughter who she has raised alone without any support from her ex-partner.

Martha currently works as a cashier in a store.  She has been working there for several years.  With her savings and financing she has built her own home.  All of her loans have been invested in improving her home.  She has only one daughter who is studying at university.  Martha rents out a room which has its own fixed entrance.  This way she manages to cover her basic expenses.

Martha's goal for this loan is to begin building two more rooms which she can rent out and thereby achieve better income in the future.  She will use her loan to buy building materials so that she can start the work at the end of her yard.  She is once again happy for the financial support provided by Afrodenic.

loans.use: To buy material such as stone, sand, cement and iron so she can begin building two rooms at the end of her yard to rent out

loans.name: Melba Cresencia

texts.es: Melba Crecencia es comerciante tiene una pulpería bien surtida desde hace mas de 10 años, cuenta con una clientela bien formada quienes se encuentran muy conformes con los precios y los productos que se encuentran a la venta en. Vive en la comarca mocoron con su marido y su hijo. Comenzó  su negocio en un lugar de su vivienda, hoy cuenta con un buen espacio para que sus clientes puedan apreciar la variedad de productos que ofrece. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada que gracias a su esfuerzo y su perseverancia ha logrado llevar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como productos de limpieza, lácteos, huevos, sopas, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Melba Crecencia is a merchant; she has had a well-stocked general store for over 10 years.  She has a well established customer base which is very satisfied with her prices and the products she has in stock.  

She lives in Mocoron with her husband and her son.  She started the store in a space in her home and she now has a good area where her customers can view the great variety of products she has on offer.

She is a very hard working, unselfish woman who thanks to her dedication and perseverance has managed to move her family ahead in life and improve their quality of life.

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise like: cleaning supplies, dairy products, eggs, soups, detergents and basic grains.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa F. est une femme de 50 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOLE depuis le 25 juin 2002. Elle a plus de 15 fois reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. 

Elle fait du petit commerce et travaille aussi en partenariat avec un de ses fils qui est tailleur. 

Avec nouveau crédit elle augment son approvisionnement en marchandises telles de légumes et fruits. Elle va aussi acheter des fournitures de coutures pour son fils tailleur

Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale. Elle prend en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Awa F. is a 50 year old woman. She is married and the mother of nine children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Ndondole since the 25th of June, 2002. She has received more than 15 loans and always repaid them without difficulty. She has a small business and also partners with one of her children, who is a tailor. With this new loan she will grow her supplies of fruits and vegetables. She will also purchase sewing supplies for her son, the tailor. She participates in caring for her family. She takes care of financing her children's educations.

loans.use: To further develop her income generating business.

loans.name: Danny Maricela

texts.es:
Danny de 27 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive con sus hijos de 11, 3 y un año en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Inicio su negocio comprando pocos productos para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que está separada. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo invertir más dinero en vegetales y frutas para tener más variedad en sus ventas. En la actualidad trabaja sola desde muy temprano hasta las 21h00pm. Vende enlatados, verduras, vegetales granos etc. Aunque no tiene a su cónyuge ella quiere seguir trabajando para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, comprando con el préstamo enlatados, arroz para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket para así que sus hijos tengan una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
