Robertha desea ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas para percibir mayores ganancias, este es el motivo de su crédito para la compra de materia prima. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia.
texts.en: Robertha Lisseth is a 32 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and 2 children.  Her business is selling general merchandise such as footwear, cosmetics and clothes.  She sells her items daily in her home and in the streets.  Her main customers are the inhabitants of the district.  She has several years' experience in this trade and owing to the quality of the products which she offers and the good service which she provides, she has a number of loyal customers.  Robertha would like to expand her business and increase her sales to make more profit.  This is her reason for requesting this loan which will be used to buy raw materials.  She is quite a responsible woman who is devoted to her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Marie.  She is married, and has 1 child aged 3. She has 5 additional dependents, who live with her. They are her sisters and her husband’s relatives. In 2005, Marie established her stationery business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in providing livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 3,225,440SLL every month from this business. 

Marie needs  a loan  of 3,000,000SLL. Marie has already received and successfully repaid four loans under the group lending scheme and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional A4 size paper and exercise books. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 322,544SLL. 

Marie intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy A4 size paper and exercise books

loans.name: Isidra Elsa

texts.es: Isidra Elsa de 70 años, es comerciante de venta de bolsitas, hielo, gaseosas Para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo tuvo que comenzar a trabajar con sus propios fondos, a pesar que era muy poco capital pero como ella quería generar sus propios ingresos decidió tener su propio local comenzó a vender a sus vecinos hasta que poco a poco ha incrementado su negocio. Para continuar con su negocio solicita este crédito que le será de mucha ayuda. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio.
texts.en: Isidra Elsa, 70, is a merchant who sells bags, ice and soft drinks in order to support her family and help her husband.  She had to start the business with her own funds. Even though she had little capital, as she wanted to generate her own income, she decided to have her own store.  She started to sell to her neighbors, and her business gradually grew.  To continue with her business she requests this loan, which will be very helpful for her. In the future she wants to have another business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 8 and 4. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives and need assistant.  In 2002, Mohamed established his Men's Wears business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,176,000 SSL every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan of 4,000,000. He has a good loan repayment history. He requires a loan in order to buy jeans, shirt and polo clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately  235,200SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to improve on his business so that he can rent a bigger shop and to educate his children.   He thanks you for your support

loans.use: The loan is use to buy men's wears such as shoes, shirts and polo cloths

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es una mujer luchadora, ella cuidó de sus 6 hijos, pero a pesar de los múltiples problemas que tuvo; siempre supo sacarlos adelante. Ahora ella vive junto a su último hijo Emerson de 12 años, al que educa y cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Kivinaki. Hace, 15 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura; del que obtuvo gran ayuda económica sobre todo,”tranquilidad y paz”, afirma. Los productos que siembra son yuca, maíz híbrido y plátanos. Los que en temporadas de gran cosecha y demanda, los comercializa en la capital del país. Pero lo que a ella más le gusta son los sembríos de plátano, ya que puede ver el capital en tan solo 15 días, ya  que es el tiempo en que demora en dar fruto y su producción lo comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad. En adelante planea incursionar en el cultivo de ají verde llamado “jalapeño”; ya que el que en los últimos años tiene gran demanda, ya que las empresas de alimentos lo exportan a otros países. María, tiene muchos proyectos e ideas por eso desea seguir trabajando con MFP, ya que de esa manera podrá cristalizar sus objetivos. Ya es el segundo préstamo que tienen y como buena socia, está feliz del éxito obtenido. 
Con el crédito que obtenga, podrá adquirir semillas, de maíz y yuca, para la campaña agrícola que se avecina. De la misma manera comprará abono, para sus platanales, ya que muy pronto cosechará plátanos, muy ricos y nutritivos.
texts.en:
María is a fighter.  She looked after her 6 children and in spite of the multiple problems which she has faced she has always managed to get them ahead.  She now lives with her youngest child Emerson who is 12 years old.  She is educating him and raising him in their own home which is located in Kivinaki community.

María has been farming for 15 years.  It has been a great economic help and above all she has gained “calm and peace” from it she confirms.  She sows yucca, hybrid corn and bananas.  In seasons of good harvest and demand she sells her products in the country's capital.  What María likes most are the fields of bananas because you can see the capital in only 15 days since that is the time it takes for them to bear fruit.  She sells her produce in her town's local market.

In the future, she plans to start growing 'ají verde', which is known in other countries as 'jalapeños' (chili peppers), since in recent years they have been in high demand because food companies are exporting them to other countries.

María has lots of projects and ideas which is why she would like to continue working with MFP as this will enable her to realize her goals.  This is the second loan which she has had.  She is a good member she is happy with the success she has achieved.

María will use her loan to acquire corn and yucca seeds for the coming agricultural season.  She will also buy fertilizer for her banana plantations since very soon she will be harvesting very rich and nutritious bananas.

loans.use: To buy yucca and corn seeds, and sacks of fertilizer for her banana plantations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan is use to buy cotton material and shoes

loans.name: Ross Mery

texts.es: Ross Mery, de 32 años, está casada con Juan Carlos, de 32 años, ambos tienen un hijo, de 3 años de edad, al que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Kivinaki. Hace 3 años, que viene administrando la botica de su tío, el cual por motivos de viaje, confió el cuidado de su establecimiento. El cual según Ros Mery, le ofrece buenas utilidades, ya que en la zona es la única que se dedica a este servicio. Sin embargo, ella; desea tener algo propio; del cual pueda sentirse orgullosa, siendo su principal cualidad la “dedicación y empeño”. Por ello está juntando algo de dinero, para abrir, un restaurante, en la zona comercial de la ciudad de Pichanaki; ya que está segura de su éxito, ahí ofrecerá platos típicos de la selva peruana, ya que es muy solicitada entre los visitantes y turistas. Ross Mery, es honesta y muy responsable; no solo con las cuotas de MFP, también en las reuniones de su banco comunal. Ya es el tercer crédito que  tienen y, se siente orgullosa de los logros obtenidos. Con el crédito que obtendrá podrá, surtir su botica, con medicamentos nuevos y repondrá los ya vendidos; con mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Ross Mery is 32 years old.  She is married to Juan Carlos who is also 32 years old.  They both have a 3 year-old son who they are educating and raising in their own home which is in the town of Kivinaki.  She has been running her uncle's drugstore since he went away on a trip and left her in charge of the establishment.  The store, according to Ros Mery, offers her good profits since it she is the only one in the district who offers this service.  However, she would like to have something of her own which she can feel proud of since her main qualities are “dedication and determination”.  For this reason she is gathering together some money to open a restaurant in the commercial district of the city of Pichanaki since she is sure of its success.  There she will offer traditional dishes of the Peruvian jungle.  They are very much in demand with visitors and tourists.

Ross Mery is honest and very responsible not only with her MFP repayments but also in the meetings of her community bank.  This is the third loan which she has had and she feels proud of what she has achieved.  She will use her loan to stock her drugstore with new medicines and replace those which she has already sold in greater quantity.

loans.use: To stock her drugstore with new medicines and to replace those which she has already sold

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara, de 40 años, convive con Isaías, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, Isabel, de 10 y Angeli de 3 años. A los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Kivinaki. Como esposos, Clara e Isaías, se distribuyen los roles del hogar. Hace 7 años, que ella, adquirió un pequeño triciclo; donde vende comida, los sábados y domingos. Pero los demás días de la semana, lo acondiciona con una diversidad de dulces, ahí todas las mañanas los niños de la escuela de la localidad, le compran la diversa variedades de dulces de diferentes marcas y tamaños. Mientras que su esposo, se dedica a la construcción de casas; lo que le resulta muy productivo, ya que no hay muchos en la población. Con el apoyo de los dos, juntaron una cantidad de ahorros con lo que piensan comprar un moto. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y como una integrante más de su banco comunal, se siente orgullosa, por los avances que está obteniendo constantemente. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá completar la compra de una moto, con el que piensa trabajar en el trasporte público.
texts.en:
Clara is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner Isaías who is also 40.  They both have 2 children, Isabel who is 10 and Angeli who is 3.  They look after and educate their children in their own home which is in the town of Kivinaki.  As husband and wife, Clara and Isaías share their household roles.  Seven years ago, Clara acquired a small three-wheeled vehicle from which she sells food on Saturdays and Sundays.  The other days of the week she prepares it for selling a variety of sweets since every morning the kids from the local school come to her and buy a variety of sweets of different brands and sizes.  Meanwhile, her husband works building houses, which is very productive since there aren't many similar businesses in the area.  Clara and her husband have both put together a quantity of savings with which they are planning to buy a motorbike. 

This is Clara's third loan with MFP and, as a member of her community bank, she feels proud of the progress which she is constantly making.  She will use her loan to complete her purchase of a motorbike which she plans to use to provide public transport services.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to provide a 'mototaxi' service

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Liberad en Progreso se encuentra formado por 16 señoras quienes son de la comunidad Zhizho que  pertenece a la parroquia de La Victoria del Portete, en las pampas de esta parroquia se libró la famosa Batalla del 27 de febrero de 1.829 que culminó con el triunfo del ejército del Gral. Antonio José de Sucre. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, nuestras socias se dedican a varias actividades las que les permite mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas muy amables, cordiales, alegres y luchan día a día en sus trabajos siempre con una sonrisa.

La Señora Miriam Q. vive en la comunidad de Zhizho que  pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue  invitada por su prima a formar parte de este grupo, tiene muy buenas amigas quienes en cada reunión salen de sus rutinas con sus bromas y alegría que irradian.

Nuestra socia se dedica hace 10 años  a la artesanía, realizar bordados que aprendió de su mamá quien labora en esta actividad, trabaja en su casa desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a sábados, sus obras las realiza bajo pedido.
Doña Miriam es muy joven, tiene 22 años y es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres la que es propia, ayuda en lo que puede a la  economía del hogar, su mamá se dedica al bordado y su padre es albañil.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos ya que va a iniciar con esta actividad y se encuentra muy optimista que le va a ir muy bien. Su meta es tener su propio taller de bordados.

La Señora María T. vive en la comunidad de Zhizho, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven cuidando una construcción en donde les dan la vivienda.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a laborar en un comedor que es de su propiedad, actividad que le viene desempeñando hace 4 años, labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a sábados y ya cuenta con algunos comensales, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y conejos los que son mas para el consumo de su hogar.

Se encuentra en el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y todos los créditos le han beneficiado para la compra para víveres para realizar sus platos. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vajillas y más víveres. Su sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The 'Libertad en Progreso' community bank has 16 female members who are from Zhizho community which is in La Victoria del Portete parish.  The plains of this parish were the site of the famous battle of 27th February 1829 which ended in victory for General Antonio José de Sucre's army.  The people of the area raise animals and farm.  The members of the community bank carry out a number of different business activities which enable them to improve their household finances.  The bank's members are very kind, friendly, happy people who work hard every day in their tasks, always with a smile.

Mrs Miriam Q. lives in Zhizho community which is in Victoria del Portete parish.  This is the second loan she has had from her community bank.  She was invited to take part in this group by her cousin.  She has very good friends who, during every meeting, step out of their routines with their jokes and the happiness which they radiate.

Miriam has been making handicrafts for 10 years.  She makes embroideries which is something she learned from her mom who works in the same activity.  She works at home from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening, from Monday to Saturday.  She makes her items to order.

Miriam is very young.  She is 22 years old and the single mother of a 2 year-old boy.  She lives in her parents' home which they own.  She helps as much as she can with the household finances.  Her mom works making embroideries and her father is a construction worker.

She will invest her loan in buying chickens since she started out in this activity and is very optimistic that it will go very well.  Her goal is to have her own embroidery workshop.

Mrs María T. lives in Zhizho community.  She is 29 years old and married.  She has 2 children aged 10 and 4.  Her eldest daughter studies in a local school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They don't have their own home so they live looking after a building where they are given accommodation.

María has a small eatery.  She has been working in this business for 4 years.  She works from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening from Monday to Saturday and she already has customers.  She also raises guinea pigs and rabbits which are mostly for her family's consumption.

This is the fifth loan which María has had from her community bank and all her loans have allowed her to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.  Her new loan will be invested in buying crockery and more supplies.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy chickens / crockery and supplies

loans.name: Los Claveles (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Los Claveles, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada de esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo. Este es un grupo de  12 señoras y 1 señor que se conocen muy bien ya que este es su quinto ciclo. Se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios).

La señora Mariela es parte de este de este Banco  hace tres ciclos y está muy contenta de haber ingresado en el Banco ya que aquí ha encontrado mucha ayuda por parte de la Fundación Espoir y del Banco comunal, ella se desempeña como fiscal de pagos función que cumple con mucho agrado. Tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta tiene tres hijos de 11 – 10 y 4 años los mayores están en escuela, su marido es chofer.

Además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). también vende sabanas y ropa en general, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o por pedidos, trabaja cuatro días en la semana por las mañanas, sus productos los compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito ella lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería pero de preferencia en ropa de mujer que es lo que más vende. Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que donde viven es alquilado.
texts.en:
In the residential area called El Progreso, located in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank Los Claveles meets every 15 days.  This is a very densely populated, marginal area of the city known as the prison sector, since the Portoviejo women's prison is located here.  The group is comprised of 12 women and one man who know each other very well as this is their fifth year together.  They are involved in different activities such as trade, sales, production and services.  

Mrs. Mariela has been active in this Bank for three years and is very happy to have gotten involved because of all the help she has received from the Espoir Foundation and the communal bank.  She acts as payment inspector and enjoys her work.  She is 25 years old, lives in a common law marriage and has three children from this union, ages 11, 10 and 4.  The older children go to school and her husband is a driver.  In addition to being a homemaker, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accesories).  And she sells bed linens and clothing in general.  Her activity involves door-to-door sales or processing orders and she works four mornings a week.  The products are purchased in Guayaquil.  She plans to use this loan to acquire more merchandise, mainly women's clothing which is what she sells mainly.  She dreams of having her own house one day since her family currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, bed sheets and women's clothing.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, D. 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y humilD., que junto a su esposo Teófilo, D. 65 años, cuidan D. su nieto Jhon, D. 18 años, al que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo D. Casacoto. Toda una vida, la dedicaron a la agricultura; D. eso hace ya 39 años, desD. entonces Lina y Teófilo, sacaron adelante a sus 10 hijos, los que ahora ya encaminados tienen su propia familia. Pero a pesar D. su avanzada edad, ellos continúan sembrando, ya que es “parte D. sus vidas”, afirman. Sus plantaciones D. papa, arveja y maíz; son los más reconocidos por la zona; sus técnicas D. cultivo, son muy admiradas, ya que utilizan métodos naturales y rústicos, lo que a ellos los llena D. orgullo, ya que mencionan que: “los frutos D. la tierra, salen D. acuerdo a como los cuidan, si es con amor y dedicación, son grandes y nutritivos”. Ahora quieren comprar abono en cantidad para poder abastecer sus más D. 2 hectáreas D. terrenos agrícolas. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, como buena integrante D. su banco comunal, es responsable y honesta con el trabajo que desempeña, ya que D. ello depenD. el éxito D. sus negocios. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir varios sacos D. semilla D. arvejas, que dentro D. algunos meses cosechará, y si el capital le alcanza, contratará peones para que la ayuden.
texts.en:
Lina, age 59, is a hardworking and humble woman, who with her husband, Theophilus, age 65, care for their 18-year-old grandson John. They take care of him and of his schooling in their own house in the village of Casacoto.

Their whole life was devoted to agriculture which they embarked on 39 years ago. Since then Lina and Theophilus raised ten children, who having been put on the right track now have their own family. 

Despite their advanced age they continue to sow, because it is "part of their lives," they say. Their plantations of potatoes, peas and corn are the most renowned in the area, their farming techniques are widely admired, as they use natural and rustic methods, which fills them with priD..

They mention that "the fruits of the earth grow according to how they are cared for: if it is with love and dedication, they will grow large and nutritious."

Now they want to buy fertilizer in bulk to be able to supply their over two hectares (5 acres) of arable land. This is their third loan with MFP. As a good member of the community bank, she is responsible and honest regarding the work performed, since on it depends the success of her business.

The loan requested will enable her to buy bags of seed peas that will be harvested within a few months. If she can afford to do so, she will also hire laborers to help her out.

loans.use: Buy pea seeds; also wants to hire laborers to help with the planting

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 37 años, convive con Miguel, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas, Liz, de 18 e Ingrid, de 15 años. Los cuatro como una gran familia viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Kivinaki. Desde las primeras horas del día, Vilma, se dirige a la escuela de la localidad, donde hace algunos años enseña a los niños de la ciudad Boca de Ipoki. Pero todos los fines de semana desde hace 8 años; junto a su esposo e hijas, viene sembrando cítricos como: naranja, mandarina, frutos que comercializa a gran escala en la capital del país. Pero los deseos de Vilma, es comenzar su cultivo de café y plátano; para ello ya compró 7 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, con lo que planea comenzar a sembrar, estos productos que tienen mayor demanda. Vilma, es una mujer responsable y como presidenta de su banco comunal, es muy puntual en los pagos a MFP. Ya es el séptimo crédito que tiene y está feliz de poder salir adelante.
Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá adquirir más plantas de café y de esa manera poder trasplantar en su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old.  She lives with Miguel who is 40 years old.  They both have 2 daughters, Liz who is 18 and Ingrid who is 15.  The four live in their own home which is located in the community of Kivinaki.  Very early in the mornings Vilma heads off to the local school where for several years she has been teaching children from the town of Boca de Ipoki.  However, every weekend for the last 8 years, together with her husband and daughters, she has been growing citrus fruits such as oranges and mandarins, fruits which she sells on a large scale in the country's capital city.

However, Vilma wishes to start growing coffee and bananas.  For this reason, she has already bought 7 hectares of farming land which she plans to start sowing with these crops which are in higher demand.

Vilma is a responsible woman and, as president of her community bank, she is very punctual in her repayments to MFP.  This is already her 7th loan cycle and she is happy to be able to get ahead.  She will use her loan to acquire more coffee plants and, in this way, be able to move her plants into her land.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants

loans.name: Juana Lucelinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Juana. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad y estudian en la universidad, mientras que los menores que son mellizos están en la escuela. Su esposo es profesor de escuela. Ella en la actualidad está estudiando para ser licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación en una Universidad a distancia y esta trabajando como profesora contratada en una escuela de la localidad.

Se dedica además de profesora y ama de casa a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, les  vende a sus compañeras de trabajo y en las tardes visita a sus clientes que tiene. Ella deja a crédito y cobra los sabados o domingos cada semana.
 
Este crédito es para comprar: perfume, cremas, cosméticos y en especial productos de promoción. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta la unión del grupo. Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) community bank meets in the 24 de Mayo canton, in Manabí province.  The area is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, its range of fauna and its hard-working people who farm and raise animals.

Here we find Juana.  She is 41 years old and married.  She has 4 children from her marriage.  The two eldest are already grown up and study at university whilst the younger two (who are twins) are in school.  Juana's husband is a school teacher.  Juana is currently studying a degree in Education Sciences from an open university and working as a teacher in a local school.

As well as being a teacher and housewife, Juana also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every morning selling to her work colleagues and in the afternoons she visits her customers.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payments every Saturday or Sunday.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and especially sale products.  Juana has been a member of her community bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes the cohesion of the group.  Her goals are to finish her studies and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and sale products

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 26 años, es una mujer dichosa, ella junto a su esposo Eutemio, de 34 años, cuidan de sus hermosos gemelos, Andy y Ronaldo, de 7 años de edad. A los que cuida con todo el amor posible, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. “El tesoro de una familia son los hijos”, con está frase comienza Lina a relatar su actividad comercial; todos los días ella se dirige al campo a cuidar de sus terrenos agrícolas, ahí su producción de papa, arveja y habas, le brindan buenos ingresos, en cada cosecha, ella negocia el precio de venta en el mercado central de su ciudad. Mientras que su esposo Eutemio, trabaja en una mina al norte del país, ambos salen adelante y muy pronto desean incrementar su producción. Los objetivos que se plantearon son el cultivo a gran escala, para poder comercializar en la capital, con ello podrán darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, de esa manera sacarlos adelante. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, porqué los integrantes le ayudan a salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 20 sacos de semillas de papa de la variedad “única”, con ello asegurará, la campaña agrícola que se avecina.
texts.en:
Lina is 26 years old.  She is a fortunate woman.  Together with her husband, 34 year-old Eutemio, she looks after her beautiful twin boys, 7 year-old Andy and Ronaldo.  She looks after them with all the love possible in her own house which is located in the town of Casacoto.  “The children are the treasure of a family”.  This is the sentence with which Lina begins telling us about her business activity.  Every day she heads out to the field to care for her land where her production of potatoes, peas and beans bring her good profits with each harvest.  She negotiates the sale price in the town's central market.

Whilst Lina's husband Eutemio works in a mine in the north of the country, both manage to get ahead and very soon they would like to increase their production.  The goals which they have are to grow on a large scale so that they can sell their product in the capital.  This would enable them to give their children a better quality of life and get the family ahead.

This is Lina's third loan with MFP and she is happy to work with her community bank because the members help her to succeed.  She will use this loan to buy 20 sacks of 'única' variety potato seeds which will help her guarantee the approaching agricultural season.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of potato seeds

loans.name: Stuart

texts.en:
When asked how long he has been working in the fish industry, Stuart explains that, “I’ve been doing this one way or another for 58 years. I started fishing when I was 12 years old.” A native of Southern California, Stuart has traveled up and down the west coast as a fish monger, selling everything from Dungeness crab to shrimp to English sole. His primary buyers are markets and wholesalers, but Stuart has also worked the farmers’ market circuit. “I don’t look at this as work,” explains Stuart, “it’s just what I do.” 
 
For over a decade Stuart has run a fresh fish wholesale business - S. Fish - based out of Watsonville, California, and in recent years his wife has joined him by taking on the business finances. The couple love running their own business and have never considered working for a larger company. “I like being my own boss, and making my own decisions. I would rather have my own business and perhaps not make as much money, because the opportunity is always there,” says Stuart. 
 
“I know most people in the fish business. It doesn’t matter what the economic climate is, if I’ve got the supply, I’ve got buyers.” However, the supply of crab and shrimp is the lowest Stuart has seen in twenty years. Stuart has always worked his way out of tough spots in the past, and in all his years as a small business owner, he has never before taken out a loan. 
 
Stuart is a strong believer in the idea that ‘when one door closes, another opens.’ An $8,000 loan from Opportunity Fund will open a new door for "S. Fish" by allowing Stuart and Stella to make the upfront investment in increased travel costs, which are necessary for them to find new suppliers and boost inventory. And, as business picks up again, "S. Fish" will be better off for the extra work they’ve put in to secure those suppliers.  
 
In the end, Stuart emphasizes the point that he enjoys what he does. “I’m having fun – that’s how it should be.”

loans.use: Boost inventory by covering increased travel costs to find new fish suppliers

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, de 25 años, está casada hace 6 años con Yuber, de 26 años, ambos tiene 2 hijos a los que educan con  mucho amor, ya que Melsi, de 6 años y Luciana, de 1 años y seis meses de nacida, son su mayor tesoro. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. El apoyo de su esposo Yuber, es vital, para ella, pues con las ganancias que obtiene en la comercialización de frutas al por mayor en el norte del país, puede alimentar y educar a sus hijos, y eso le ofrece una economía estable. Mientras que ella se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde hace ya 5 años que viene sembrando papa y arveja, que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad, con las ganancias que obtiene, puede darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. Como también está ahorrando, para poner un negocio de frutas a gran escala, donde pueda abastecer a todos los comercializadores de todo el Perú. Margot, está segura que con la experiencia ganada por su esposo lo logrará. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está segura, de que tomó una buena decisión, agradece a los integrantes de su banco comunal, por ofrecerle la oportunidad de salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar 20 sacos de abono orgánico, e invertirá en el pago del salario de los peones que le ayudarán.
texts.en:
Margot is 25 years old.  She has been married for six years to 26 year-old Yuber.  The couple have 2 chldren who they are educating with a lot of love since 6 year-old Melsi and 18 month-old Luciana are her greatest treasure.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of Casacoto.  The support of her husband Yuber is vital for her since with the profits which they obtain in selling their fruit wholesale in the north of the country, they can feed and educate their children and this offers them a stable economic situation.  Margot works tending her land where she has been growing potatoes and peas for the last 5 years.  After each harvest she sells her produce in the town's central market.  With the profits which she makes she is able to provide her children with a better life.  

She  is also saving to set up a large-scale fruit business where she can supply salespeople from all over Peru.  Margot is sure that, with the experience her husband has, she will achieve her goal.

This is her first loan from MFP and she is sure that she made a good decision.  She is grateful to the members of her community bank for having offered her this opportunity to get ahead.  She will use her loan to buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer and will invest in paying the salary of the laborers who will help her.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and contract laborers to help her with the sowing of her crops

loans.name: Angelica Liliana

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 

La señora Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal hace  dos años y dice que se siente muy a gusto en el mismo por la ayuda que recibe de parte de la fundación, así como también de parte de sus compañeras del grupo. Ella tiene 37 años de edad,  de estado civil divorciada, pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 15 y 10 años, el mayor esta en el colegio y el otro en la escuela.
 
Se dedica al comercio vende productos Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas).  También vende ropa y zapatos por catálogo, vende puerta a puerta y también en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local  donde sus clientes en su mayoría la visitan para hacerle sus pedidos y sus compras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, deja a crédito aunque la mayor parte de  las ventas son al contado. Sus productos lo que es ropa y zapatos se los envían desde Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar: ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes y accesorios de damas. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y poder ampliar su casa que es pequeña.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo district of the province of Manabí is known for its beautiful landscape, forests, wildlife and also for its hardworking people employed in agriculture and animal rearing. This is where the Madres Para Un Futuro Mejor (Mothers for a Better Future) Communal Bank meets every fortnight.

Angélica has been a member of the Communal Bank for two years and says she feels very happy there because of the help she receives from the foundation, as well as from her fellow group members. She is 37 years old, divorced and has two children aged 15 and 10 from her former marriage. The eldest child is in secondary school and the other attends primary school.
 
She makes her living from selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories). She also sells clothes and shoes from a catalogue, selling door to door and also in her own home, where she has a small shop where most of her customers visit her to make their orders and purchases. She works every day from 8.30am til 4.30pm, she offers credit, though most of her sales are paid in cash. Her clothes and shoes items are sent from Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy: clothes, shoes, lotions, perfumes and ladies' accessories. Her dream is to have a bigger shop and be able to extend her small house.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, lotions, perfumes and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 19 años, es una joven muy responsable y con muchas aspiraciones, ella vive junto a sus padres y sus 3 hermanos en la localidad de Casacoto. Ella agradece a Dios, por haberla encaminado. Como buena hija apoya a sus padres en los gastos de la casa. Trabaja en las mañanas en una tienda agropecuaria y, por las tardes estudia la carrera de Computación, ya le falta pocos años. Terminando desea ejercer su carrera, pero también desea tener algo propio; por ello está planeado abrir su propia tienda agrícola, donde no solo podrá vender productos propios para la agricultura, también desea capacitarlos e instruirlos. Ahora su proyecto es sembrar papa y habas; en el terreno que su padre le heredó,”por el momento, solo comenzaré, con una pequeña producción”, afirma. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de pertenecer a un banco comunal, que integran personas triunfadoras y con muchas ambiciones. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa adquirir abono y semillas de habas; que dentro de poco sembrará.
texts.en:
Judith is 19 years old.  She is a very responsible young woman with many aspirations.  She lives with her parents and 3 siblings in the town of Casacoto.  She thanks God for having put her on the right path.  As a good daughter she supports her parents with the household expenses.  She works in the mornings in a farming and livestock store and, in the afternoon, she is studying a computing course.  She hasn't got many years left in her course.  When she finishes, she would like to pursue her career in computing but she would also like to have something of her own.  For this reason, she is planning to open her own agricultural store where she will not only sell farming products but also provide training and teaching.  Now her project is to sow potatoes and beans in the land which her father gave her as an inheritance.  “Right now, I will just begin with a small production”, she confirms. 

This is Judith's first loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to a community bank which has such successful members with many ambitions.  She intends to use the loan she is requesting to acquire fertilizer and bean seeds which she will sow very shortly.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and bean seeds

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida, de 21 años, es una mujer fuerte, que, junto a su esposo Teófilo, de 31 años, cuidan a su hijo Linconl, de 3 años, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. Ahí, todas las mañanas se hace cargo de sus cultivos de papa y arveja, que hace 7 años, adquirió su esposo Teófilo; pero gracias a la buena administración de ella, pudo alquilar un nuevo terreno agrícola, donde siembra más cantidad de hortalizas, ya que según menciona, son los que mayor demanda tienen. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder compartir un momento con su familia; ya que su esposo, trabaja como chofer trasportando varios sacos de producción a otros lugares del país, donde aprovecha, y lleva a vender las cosechas de Zoraida. Que gracias a su buen cuidado son muy bien pagadas. Eso la incentiva y en el futuro, desea adquirir más terrenos agrícolas, donde piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir 60 sacos de abono, para sembrar papa de la variedad “única” y “canchay”.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 21, is a strong woman.  Together with her husband, Teófilo, 32, she cares for her their 3 year-old son, Linconl. They live in a rented house in the locality of Casacoto. There, every morning, she is in charge of her potato and pea crops, which she took over from her husband 7 years ago. Thanks to her good management, she has since been able to rent a new plot of farmland where she plants more vegetables, particularly those most in demand.

Her favorite thing is to be able to share something with her family. Her husband works as a driver, transporting various amounts of products to other parts of the country, where he takes advantage and also sells what Zoraida harvests. Thanks to her good care, they are well paid. This encourages her and in the future, she hopes to acquire more farmland so that she can plant more.

This is her third loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to work with her communal bank because its members are group-minded and hard-working. She will be able to buy 60 sacks of fertilizer with this loan, which she will use to plant potatoes of the "única" and "canchay" varieties.

loans.use: to buy 60 sacks of fertilizer for planting potatoes

loans.name: Ertrudes

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ertrudes.  Ella tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta linda relación que la ha cuidado por tantos años tiene un hijo de 17 años, el cual estudia en el último año del colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas tales como: gaseosas, aguas, bebidas energizantes, cervezas, bocadillos, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, los productos que son de fabrica los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes , aguas cervezas y otros productos. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace ya varios años y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe. Sus sueños son tener un bar completo y más grande.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo canton is in the Manabí province.  It is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, a variety of fauna, and its hard-working people who devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  This is where the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For a Better Future) meets every two weeks.

This is where we find 54 year old Ertrudes.  She has taken great care of her long time, beautiful marriage, and she and her husband have a 17 year old child.  He is in his last year of school.  Her husband is a merchant.

In addition to being a very good housewife, she is also a merchant.  She has a small bar where she sells drinks like soft drinks, water, energizing drinks, beer, and snacks, etc.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She gets the factory products for her place.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, energizing drinks, water, beer, and other products.  She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning several years ago.  She likes the benefits that she receives.  Her dream is to have a replete and larger bar.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, energizing drinks, water, and beer, etc.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 20 años, es un joven bueno y responsable, que junto a su esposa Jessica, de 20 años; cuida de su hijo Diego de 1 año de nacido. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. Hace 2 años, que de dedica a la compra y venta de papa, al por mayor, donde viaja a diferentes lugares del país para poder comercializar la producción de su localidad. Pero cuando, formó su familia, decidió invertir en la agricultura, de esa manera tendría un ingreso extra, fue así que comenzó con la siembra de papa, arvejas y habas (productos agrícolas). Las que con el apoyo de Jessica, puede cuidarlas y verlas crecer fuertes y sin mayores dificultades. Pero consiente, de que tiene que trabajar para poder darle un buen futuro a su familia, está pensando expandir más su negocio de venta al por mayor, “lo más importantes en este negocio es ser conocido “, afirma. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está segura que como los integrantes de su banco comunal, él podrá salir adelante junto a su trabajo y su familia. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá invertir en el flete de transporte, para su próxima carga de papa, que en estos días comercializará.
texts.en:
Wilder is 20 years old.  He is a good and responsible young man who, together with his wife, 20 year-old Jessica, looks after his 1 year-old son Diego.  They live together in a rental house which is in the town of Casacoto.  For two years he has been buying and selling potatoes wholesale.  He travels to different places in the country to sell his town's produce.  However, when he started his family, he decided to invest in farming in order to have an additional income.  He started sowing potatoes, peas and beans (agricultural products).  With Jessica's support, he can tend them and watch them grow strong, without many problems.  However, conscious of the fact that he must work to provide his family with a good future, he is thinking of expanding his wholesale business.  “The most important thing in this business is to be known”, he confirms.

This is Wilder's first loan with MFP and he is sure that, in the same way as the other members of his community bank, he will be able to get ahead with his work and his family.  He will use the loan he is requesting to invest in transportation charges for his next load of potatoes which he is about to sell.

loans.use: To pay the transportation charges for the potatoes which he will sell

loans.name: Maria Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
Hace 11 años ella empezó a integrar el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor y desde que obtuvo su primer crédito ella mejoro su futuro, gracias a los créditos ella pudo incrementar su negocio y por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 14 – 13 y 4 años de edad,  los mayores están en el colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 10am hasta las 16h00. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo y Guayaquil ciudades que visita una o dos veces por mes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana los días domingos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa para niños. Sus sueños ser una gran empresaria y tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo canton is in the Manabí province.  It is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, a variety of fauna, and its hard-working people who devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  This is where the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For a Better Future) Communal Bank meets every two weeks.

She became a member of the Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor Communal Bank 11 years ago.  Ever since she got her first loan she improved her future.  Thanks to the loans she was able to increase her business, and she is very grateful to the Fundación Espoir for this.  

She is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  The children are 14, 13, and 4 years old.  The oldest ones are in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  She sells all types of clothes door to door.  She works Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  She buys the merchandise in the cities of Portoviejo and Guayaquil.  She goes there once or twice a month.  She gives credit, and she collects every Sunday.

She will use this loan to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.  Her dreams are to be a great businesswoman and to have a good place.

loans.use: To buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
Aquí encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 47 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo que en la actualidad tiene 17 años de edad, el mismo que cursa el último año del colegio, nuestra socia dice que su vida fue muy difícil pero que después fue mejorando, con unos recursos que ella tenía decidió poner una tienda.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Aunque también vende artículos de bazar y otros para el hogar como platos, ollas, planchas, y más artículos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00 y su hijo  le ayuda en su negocio, sus productos los compra la mayoría en Portoviejo y una parte la recibe en su local. Lleva en su negocio ya muchos años y le ha ido bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, atún y otros artículos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya cuatro años y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho en momentos difíciles. Su sueño es tener una tienda más grande.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo canton is in the Manabí province.  It is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, a variety of fauna, and its hard-working people who devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  This is where the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For a Better Future) meets every two weeks.

This is where we find María.  She is a 47 years old single mother, and she has a 17 year old child who is in his last year of school.  She says that her life has been very difficult, but it has been getting better.  She decided to use some resources that she had to set up a store.  

She has a store selling basic needs items like rice, sugar, and oil, etc.  She also sells bazaar items and other things for the home like dishes, pots, irons and more.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Her son helps her in the business.  She buys the majority of her products in Portoviejo, and some of them are delivered to her place.  She has had her business for many years, and it has gone well for her. 

 This loan is to buy rice, sugar, oil, tuna, and other products.  She has been in her communal bank for four years.  She likes it because they have helped her a great deal during difficult times.  Her dream is to have a larger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, tuna, and other products

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. N., 37, is a villager in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice and herbs to sell to support her family. This is the season to grow herbs, but she hasn't had enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. Chan S. N. is asking for a loan to help grow herbs this year. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are students, and they are helping their mother’s business.

loans.use: To grow herbs

loans.name: Mr. Loch Chantha Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 14 people who live in Tuol Tnaot village in Kandal province. Mr. Loch C., 27 years old and the village bank president, has been selected by the other group members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns money to support his family, while his wife, Mrs. Sovan Soy, owns a general store in local village, where she sells groceries to earn large profits to support her family. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mr. Loch C. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. This couple has two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina E. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: Pig Fattening and Fishing businesses. Her husband Arnel E., who is 39 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have 4 children who are 8 to 17 years old with two of them already working while the other two are currently going to school.

 Cristina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cristina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Cristina E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.   

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on  a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.name: Deoditha

texts.en:
Deoditha C. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a lumber yard and a fishing business. She lives in Purok Croton's A, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. 

Deoditha has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her lumber yard and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 60000. 

Deoditha is borrowing PHP 29500 to augment her working capital. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Deoditha aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas R. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $1 per day. Her husband also helps her in the same business.  Meas R. owns a farm that she inherited from her grandmother and she grows various crops on it.

Meas R. currently has one small shop in front of a garment factory where she sells a few products such as snacks, plastic products, and soft drinks.

This couple has been married for years and they have four children.  All of them are employed in the factory and receive a formal salary per month. Meas R. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan to be used to buy a larger number of essential items to sell.

loans.use: To buy a larger number of essential items to sell.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy D. is a married woman who lives in Purok Banagan, Barangay Tomongtong, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: crab netting (panggalan) and a fishing business. Her husband Amor, who is 32 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 1 and 12 years old. Amy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy a new engine for her fishing boat so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. Amy D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. Her husband Joselito C., who is 38 years old, works as a construction worker to earn his living. They have 8 children who are 1 to 25 years old. Arlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arlene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use to buy more raw abaca to weave so that she could continue to save up for the future and help her husband with the daily living expenses and for the education of their children. Arlene C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. loans.name: 03.01.38 Cho Dien Bien Group

texts.en: Nga L. T. T. (186) is a 35 year old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Nga is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 38-Cho Dien Bien (03.01.38). Nga is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To making a living, Nga owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling pork in the local community. Nga has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2010, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nga is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. T. Thuong (184) is a 27 year old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop. 2. N. T. Hien (185) is a 24 year old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Nga L. T. T. (186) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Nga là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 38-Cho Dien Bien (03.01.38). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nga thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nga kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. Vào 2010, Nga đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nga đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Thuong (184) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt. 2. N. T. Hien (185) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en: Aireen L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Santa Cruz, Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. Her husband Eddie L., who is 28 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 7 months and 2 years old. Aireen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aireen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy a pump boat so that she could continue to save up for the future and to create another business. loans.name: 03.05.39Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Lan D. T. (193) is a 49 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Lan is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 39 Dien Bien (03.05.39 Dien Bien).

Lan, who is married and has two adult -aged children, owns and operates a food stall selling rice products in the local community. Engaged in this business for over five years, she earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5.310.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to invest in expanding the business, Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. T. T. Hoa (191) is a 59-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.310.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2. Lê T. Tho (192) is a 62 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.310.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

3. B. T. Thanh (195) is a 45-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall. 4. N. T. Hanh (196) is a 52-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.310.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall. 5. L. T. Huong (199) is a 74-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.310.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

6. N. T. Huyen (201) is a 34-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.310.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Z. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three businesses: a restaurant, a meat-vending business, and a fish-vending business. Her husband, Guillermo Z., who is 50 years old, works as an elected municipal official (sangguniang bayan member) to earn his living. They have two children who are 17 and 25 years old. Vilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired after something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 24,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eleventh loan cycle, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for future house renovation and educational plans. Vilma Z. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng T. has spent her life cultivating crops in the Cambodian city of Phnom Penh. This is a skill she learned from a grandparent when she was young. Her husband is a taxi driver in and around her community and other provinces. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. She is now married and has three children, all of whom are single. Two of her children are studying in school, while the other one is employed in a garment factory. Presently, her two children will go to learn at the next level, so she needs some money to pay for school fees. She is concerned that her savings will not be enough, so Heng T. wishes to borrow a loan in order to pay for school for her children.
 
Heng T. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To pay for school for her children

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., age 71, is a widow living in Phnom Penh. (She was not available the day of the photo, so her son is pictured instead.) Her husband suffered from dementia and died years ago. Chan L. is a homemaker and manages all the family's daily household duties such as cooking, washing, and managing cash flow. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are married. The income for the family comes from the three of her children who work at a garment factory and one daughter who has been tailoring from home for several years.

The daughter's tailoring business requires more materials, such as a new sewing machine. Chan L. is requesting a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine, a purchase which will enable her daughter to sew clothes more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her daughter's tailoring business

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Res

texts.en:
Res P. is an older woman and a single mother who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Res P. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family.

 Res P. also travels to sell her medicine, walking around her community. Res P. has four children and all of them are single. One of her children is selling a few products such as plastic items, perfumes, and beauty products to people in and around his community. Res P.’ son wishes to have more money to increase his capital to purchase more items for extra profits. So Res P. will use her loan to support her son’s business in order to buy some products to resale. Res P. was not available for photographing, so her son is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy some products to resell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy B. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sta. Cruz, Brgy. Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a fishing / fish vending business.  Her husband Vicente B., who is 50 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 4 to 19 years old.  One of their children has their own family. Another one works and the other seven are currently going to school. 

Judy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Judy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,900, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy fishnet so that she can continue to save up for the future and the business. 

Judy B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

 About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Sasfy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sasfy L. (in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Man Kob, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sasfy sells clothes. She buys them from Phnom Penh market for resale in the local market. Her husband is a construction worker and fisherman. 

Sasfy is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to continue her business by purchasing clothes for resale. She will use a part of her loan to buy fishing gear for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: purchasing clothes for resale and buying fishing gear for her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Lovyne

texts.en:
Lovyne L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sta. Cruz, Brgy. Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing / fish vending and food vending businesses. Her husband Dario L., who is 38 years old, works in furniture to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are seven to 17 years old.

 Lovyne joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lovyne has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use as working capital for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lovyne L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
